You're by no means alone on that score, you'll be excited and stimulated to know. Many, many men have been just as troubled morally and spiritually as you are right now. Happily, some of them kept records of their troubles. You'll learn from them-if you want to. Just as someday, if you have something to offer, someone will learn something from you. It's a beautiful reciprocal arrangement. And it isn't education. It's history. It's poetry.

quotes.author: Haruki Murakami
quotes.quote: Sometimes fate is like a small sandstorm that keeps changing directions. You change direction but the sandstorm chases you. You turn again, but the storm adjusts. Over and over you play this out, like some ominous dance with death just before dawn. Why? Because this storm isn't something that blew in from far away, something that has nothing to do with you. This storm is you. Something inside of you. So all you can do is give in to it, step right inside the storm, closing your eyes and plugging up your ears so the sand doesn't get in, and walk through it, step by step. There's no sun there, no moon, no direction, no sense of time. Just fine white sand swirling up into the sky like pulverized bones. That's the kind of sandstorm you need to imagine.An you really will have to make it through that violent, metaphysical, symbolic storm. No matter how metaphysical or symbolic it might be, make no mistake about it: it will cut through flesh like a thousand razor blades. People will bleed there, and you will bleed too. Hot, red blood. You'll catch that blood in your hands, your own blood and the blood of others.And once the storm is over you won't remember how you made it through, how you managed to survive. You won't even be sure, in fact, whether the storm is really over. But one thing is certain. When you come out of the storm you won't be the same person who walked in. That's what this storm's all about.

quotes.author: Eric Roth
quotes.book: The Curious Case of Benjamin Button Screenplay
quotes.quote: For what it's worth: it's never too late or, in my case, too early to be whoever you want to be. There's no time limit, stop whenever you want. You can change or stay the same, there are no rules to this thing. We can make the best or the worst of it. I hope you make the best of it. And I hope you see things that startle you. I hope you feel things you never felt before. I hope you meet people with a different point of view. I hope you live a life you're proud of. If you find that you're not, I hope you have the courage to start all over again.

quotes.author: Aldous Huxley
quotes.quote: You shall know the truth and the truth shall make you mad.

quotes.author: Paulo Coelho
quotes.quote: When you find your path, you must not be afraid. You need to have sufficient courage to make mistakes. Disappointment, defeat, and despair are the tools God uses to show us the way.

quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin
quotes.book: Memoirs of the life & writings of Benjamin Franklin
quotes.quote: They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.

quotes.author: Keri Hulme
quotes.quote: You want to know about anybody? See what books they read, and how they've been read...

quotes.author: C.S. Lewis
quotes.quote: It is a good rule after reading a new book, never to allow yourself another new one till you have read an old one in between.

quotes.author: Deepak Chopra
quotes.quote: Every time you are tempted to react in the same old way, ask if you want to be a prisoner of the past or a pioneer of the future.

quotes.author: Umberto Eco
quotes.quote: Books are not made to be believed, but to be subjected to inquiry. When we consider a book, we mustn't ask ourselves what it says but what it means...

quotes.author: A.A. Milne
quotes.quote: One of the advantages of being disorganized is that one is always having surprising discoveries.

quotes.author: William Blake
quotes.quote: A truth that's told with bad intent beats all the lies you can invent.

quotes.author: William Wordsworth
quotes.quote: Fill your paper with the breathings of your heart.

quotes.author: Fernando Pessoa
quotes.quote: Literature is the most agreeable way of ignoring life.

quotes.author: Arthur Schopenhauer
quotes.quote: Compassion is the basis of morality.

quotes.author: Carl Sandburg
quotes.quote: Time is the coin of your life. You spend it. Do not allow others to spend it for you.

quotes.author: Conan O'Brien
quotes.quote: If you work really hard, and you're kind, amazing things will happen.

quotes.author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
quotes.quote: My soul is from elsewhere, I'm sure of that, and I intend to end up there.

quotes.author: Beatrix Potter
quotes.quote: There is something delicious about writing the first words of a story. You never quite know where they'll take you.

quotes.author: L. Frank Baum
quotes.quote: There is no place like home.

quotes.author: Terry Pratchett
quotes.quote: Wisdom comes from experience. Experience is often a result of lack of wisdom.

quotes.author: Suzanne Collins
quotes.quote: May the odds be ever in your favor!

quotes.author: John Grisham
quotes.quote: Don't compromise yourself - you're all you have.

quotes.author: Winston Churchill
quotes.quote: Tact is the ability to tell someone to go to hell in such a way that they look forward to the trip.

quotes.author: Jim Morrison
quotes.quote: Expose yourself to your deepest fear; after that, fear has no power, and the fear of freedom shrinks and vanishes. You are free.

quotes.author: Dr. Seuss
quotes.quote: Then the Grinch thought of something he hadn't before! What if Christmas, he thought, doesn't come from a store. What if Christmas...perhaps...means a little bit more!

quotes.author: E.Y. Harburg
quotes.quote: Somewhere over the rainbow, skies are blue, and the dreams that you dare to dream really do come true.

quotes.author: Mae West
quotes.quote: I wrote the story myself. It's about a girl who lost her reputation and never missed it.

quotes.author: Orhan Pamuk
quotes.quote: Happiness is holding someone in your arms and knowing you hold the whole world.

quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw
quotes.quote: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man.

quotes.author: Honore de Balzac
quotes.quote: Reading brings us unknown friends

quotes.author: Michael Ondaatje
quotes.quote: She had always wanted words, she loved them; grew up on them. Words gave her clarity, brought reason, shape.

quotes.author: Kurt Vonnegut
quotes.quote: A purpose of human life, no matter who is controlling it, is to love whoever is around to be loved.

quotes.author: Oscar Wilde
quotes.quote: To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance.

quotes.author: Dodie Smith
quotes.quote: There is only one page left to write on. I will fill it with words of only one syllable. I love. I have loved. I will love.

quotes.author: Markus Zusak
quotes.quote: A snowball in the face is surely the perfect beginning to a lasting friendship.

quotes.author: P.C. Cast
quotes.quote: Remember, darkness does not always equate to evil, just as light does not always bring good.

quotes.author: The Dalai Lama
quotes.quote: If you think you are too small to make a difference, try sleeping with a mosquito.

quotes.author: Pablo Neruda
quotes.quote: You can cut all the flowers but you cannot keep Spring from coming.

quotes.author: Emma Donoghue
quotes.quote: Scared is what you're feeling. Brave is what you're doing.

quotes.author: Henry Miller
quotes.quote: A book lying idle on a shelf is wasted ammunition.

quotes.author: Steve Maraboli
quotes.book: Life, the Truth, and Being Free
quotes.quote: If people refuse to look at you in a new light and they can only see you for what you were, only see you for the mistakes you've made, if they don't realize that you are not your mistakes, then they have to go.

quotes.author: Charles Dickens
quotes.quote: Have a heart that never hardens, and a temper that never tires, and a touch that never hurts.

quotes.author: Ray Bradbury
quotes.quote: Stuff your eyes with wonder, he said, live as if you'd drop dead in ten seconds. See the world. It's more fantastic than any dream made or paid for in factories.

quotes.author: Milan Kundera
quotes.quote: When the heart speaks, the mind finds it indecent to object.

quotes.author: Elizabeth Gilbert
quotes.quote: When I get lonely these days, I think: So BE lonely. Learn your way around loneliness. Make a map of it. Sit with it, for once in your life. Welcome to the human experience. But never again use another person's body or emotions as a scratching post for your own unfulfilled yearnings.

quotes.author: Galway Kinnell
quotes.quote: Let our scars fall in love.

quotes.author: Mark Twain
quotes.quote: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear - not absence of fear.

quotes.author: Cassandra Clare
quotes.quote: You endure what is unbearable, and you bear it. That is all.

quotes.author: Suzanne Collins
quotes.quote: I always channel my emotions into my work. That way, I don't hurt anyone but myself.

quotes.author: Alan Moore
quotes.quote: People shouldn't be afraid of their government. Governments should be afraid of their people.

quotes.author: Susan Sontag
quotes.quote: I haven't been everywhere, but it's on my list.

quotes.author: H. P. Lovecraft
quotes.quote: The world is indeed comic, but the joke is on mankind.

quotes.author: Horace Mann
quotes.quote: A house without books is like a room without windows.

quotes.author: Orson Welles
quotes.quote: Ask not what you can do for your country. Ask what's for lunch.

quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks
quotes.quote: In time, the hurt began to fade and it was easier to just let it go. At least I thought it was. But in every boy I met in the next few years, I found myself looking for you, and when the feelings got too strong, I'd write you another letter. But I never sent them for fear of what I might find. By then, you'd gone on with your life and I didn't want to think about you loving someone else. I wanted to remember us like we were that summer. I didn't ever want to lose that.

quotes.author: Frank Zappa
quotes.quote: If you end up with a boring miserable life because you listened to your mom, your dad, your teacher, your priest, or some guy on television telling you how to do your shit, then you deserve it.

quotes.author: John Boyne
quotes.quote: There's things that happen in a person's life that are so scorched in the memory and burned into the heart that there's no forgetting them.

quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey
quotes.quote: You can have it all. Just not all at once.

quotes.author: Dr. Seuss
quotes.quote: I meant what I said and I said what I meant. An elephant's faithful one-hundred percent!

quotes.author: C.S. Lewis
quotes.quote: I'm on Aslan's side even if there isn't any Aslan to lead it. I'm going to live as like a Narnian as I can even if there isn't any Narnia.

quotes.author: Margaret Walker
quotes.quote: When I was about eight, I decided that the most wonderful thing, next to a human being, was a book.

quotes.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay
quotes.quote: I know I am but summer to your heart, and not the full four seasons of the year.

quotes.author: Astrid Lindgren
quotes.quote: A childhood without books – that would be no childhood. That would be like being shut out from the enchanted place where you can go and find the rarest kind of joy.

quotes.author: Bill Cosby
quotes.quote: A word to the wise ain't necessary, it's the stupid ones who need advice.

quotes.author: Eoin Colfer
quotes.quote: Confidence is ignorance. If you're feeling cocky, it's because there's something you don't know.

quotes.author: Euripides
quotes.quote: Talk sense to a fool and he calls you foolish.

quotes.author: Tennessee Williams
quotes.book: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
quotes.quote: I've got the guts to die. What I want to know is, have you got the guts to live?

quotes.author: Milan Kundera
quotes.quote: Anyone whose goal is 'something higher' must expect someday to suffer vertigo. What is vertigo? Fear of falling? No, Vertigo is something other than fear of falling. It is the voice of the emptiness below us which tempts and lures us, it is the desire to fall, against which, terrified, we defend ourselves.

quotes.author: Walt Whitman
quotes.quote: Do I contradict myself? Very well, then, I contradict myself; I am large -- I contain multitudes.

quotes.author: Douglas Adams
quotes.book: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
quotes.quote: Isn't it enough to see that a garden is beautiful without having to believe that there are fairies at the bottom of it too?

quotes.author: Joseph Heller
quotes.quote: Just because you're paranoid doesn't mean they aren't after you.

quotes.author: Dorothy Parker
quotes.quote: If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to.

quotes.author: Markus Zusak
quotes.quote: Sometimes you read a book so special that you want to carry it around with you for months after you've finished just to stay near it.

quotes.author: Stephanie Perkins
quotes.quote: Is it possible for home to be a person and not a place?

quotes.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quotes.quote: Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake.

quotes.author: Kiera Cass
quotes.quote: Break my heart. Break it a thousand times if you like. It was only ever yours to break anyway.

quotes.author: Karen Marie Moning
quotes.quote: I love books, by the way, way more than movies. Movies tell you what to think. A good book lets you choose a few thoughts for yourself. Movies show you the pink house. A good book tells you there's a pink house and lets you paint some of the finishing touches, maybe choose the roof style,park your own car out front. My imagination has always topped anything a movie could come up with. Case in point, those darned Harry Potter movies. That was so not what that part-Veela-chick, Fleur Delacour, looked like.

quotes.author: Tahereh Mafi
quotes.quote: I'm oxygen and he's dying to breathe.

quotes.author: J.K. Rowling
quotes.book: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
quotes.quote: Perhaps those who are best suited to power are those who have never sought it. Those who have leadership thrust upon them, and take up the mantle because they must, and find to their own surprise that they wear it well.

quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
quotes.quote: The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.

quotes.author: Herbert Hoover
quotes.quote: Older men declare war. But it is youth that must fight and die.

quotes.author: Yogi Berra
quotes.book: When You Come to a Fork in the Road, Take It!: Inspiration and Wisdom from One of Baseball's Greatest Heroes
quotes.quote: Always go to other people's funerals, otherwise they won't come to yours.

quotes.author: Terry Pratchett
quotes.quote: In the beginning there was nothing, which exploded.

quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks
quotes.quote: Truth only means something when it's hard to admit.

quotes.author: Doris Lessing
quotes.quote: Whatever you're meant to do, do it now. The conditions are always impossible.

quotes.author: Kurt Vonnegut
quotes.quote: And I asked myself about the present: how wide it was, how deep it was, how much was mine to keep.

quotes.author: Zig Ziglar
quotes.quote: Lack of direction, not lack of time, is the problem. We all have twenty-four hour days.

quotes.author: Eugene Field
quotes.quote: No book can be appreciated until it has been slept with and dreamed over.

quotes.author: Laini Taylor
quotes.quote: Once upon a time, an angel and a devil fell in love. It did not end well.

quotes.author: Albert Camus
quotes.quote: The only way to deal with an unfree world is to become so absolutely free that your very existence is an act of rebellion.

quotes.author: Stephen Chbosky
quotes.book: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
quotes.quote: And I guess I realized at that moment that I really did love her. Because there was nothing to gain, and that didn't matter.

quotes.author: Emily Brontë
quotes.quote: Be with me always - take any form - drive me mad! only do not leave me in this abyss, where I cannot find you! Oh, God! it is unutterable! I can not live without my life! I can not live without my soul!

quotes.author: Rick Riordan
quotes.quote: Families are messy. Sometimes the best we can do is to remind each other that we're related for better or for worse...and try to keep the maiming and killing to a minimum.

quotes.author: William Saroyan
quotes.quote: When you laugh, laugh like hell. And when you get angry, get good and angry. Try to be alive. You will be dead soon enough.

quotes.author: Lauren Kate
quotes.quote: Sometimes beautiful things come into our lives out of nowhere. We can't always understand them, but we have to trust in them. I know you want to question everything, but sometimes it pays to just have a little faith.

quotes.author: John Green
quotes.quote: He was gone, and I did not have time to tell him what I had just now realized: that I forgave him, and that she forgave us, and that we had to forgive to survive in the labyrinth. There were so many of us who would have to live with things done and things left undone that day. Things that did not go right, things that seemed okay at the time because we could not see the future. If only we could see the endless string of consequences that result from our smallest actions. But we can't know better until knowing better is useless. And as I walked back to give Takumi's note to the Colonel, I saw that I would never know. I would never know her well enough to know her thoughts in those last minutes, would never know if she left us on purpose. But the not-knowing would not keep me from caring, and I would always love Alaska Young, my crooked neighbor, with all my crooked heart.

quotes.author: Max Lucado
quotes.book: He Still Moves Stones: Everyone Needs a Miracle
quotes.quote: Faith is not the belief that God will do what you want. It is the belief that God will do what is right.

quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln
quotes.quote: Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power.

quotes.author: Dr. Seuss
quotes.quote: Adults are just obsolete children and the hell with them.

quotes.author: Hunter S. Thompson
quotes.book: The Proud Highway: Saga of a Desperate Southern Gentleman, 1955-1967
quotes.quote: A man who procrastinates in his choosing will inevitably have his choice made for him by circumstance.

quotes.author: Haruki Murakami
quotes.quote: It's like Tolstoy said. Happiness is an allegory, unhappiness a story.

quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin
quotes.quote: Tell me and I forget, teach me and I may remember, involve me and I learn.

quotes.author: Neil Gaiman
quotes.quote: Tomorrow may be hell, but today was a good writing day, and on the good writing days nothing else matters.

quotes.author: Sylvia Plath
quotes.quote: I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead; I lift my eyes and all is born again.

quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quotes.quote: The glory of friendship is not the outstretched hand, not the kindly smile, nor the joy of companionship; it is the spiritual inspiration that comes to one when you discover that someone else believes in you and is willing to trust you with a friendship.

quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy
quotes.quote: He stepped down, trying not to look long at her, as if she were the sun, yet he saw her, like the sun, even without looking.

quotes.author: John Green
quotes.quote: The pleasure of remembering had been taken from me, because there was no longer anyone to remember with. It felt like losing your co-rememberer meant losing the memory itself, as if the things we'd done were less real and important than they had been hours before.

quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks
quotes.quote: People come, people go – they'll drift in and out of your life, almost like characters in a favorite book. When you finally close the cover, the characters have told their story and you start up again with another book, complete with new characters and adventures. Then you find yourself focusing on the new ones, not the ones from the past.

quotes.author: C. S. Lewis
quotes.quote: I have learned now that while those who speak about one's miseries usually hurt, those who keep silence hurt more.

quotes.author: Oscar Wilde
quotes.quote: Who, being loved, is poor?

quotes.author: Albert Einstein
quotes.quote: If A is a success in life, then A equals x plus y plus z. Work is x; y is play; and z is keeping your mouth shut

quotes.author: Nick Hornby
quotes.quote: It's no good pretending that any relationship has a future if your record collections disagree violently or if your favorite films wouldn't even speak to each other if they met at a party.

quotes.author: Arthur William Edgar O'Shaughnessy
quotes.quote: We are the music makers, and we are the dreamers of dreams.

quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw
quotes.quote: Animals are my friends...and I don't eat my friends.

quotes.author: J.D. Salinger
quotes.quote: I'm sick of just liking people. I wish to God I could meet somebody I could respect.

quotes.author: Sarah Dessen
quotes.quote: I like flaws. I think they make things interesting.

quotes.author: Lillian Hellman
quotes.quote: People change and forget to tell each other.

quotes.author: Paulo Coelho
quotes.quote: When we least expect it, life sets us a challenge to test our courage and willingness to change; at such a moment, there is no point in pretending that nothing has happened or in saying that we are not yet ready. The challenge will not wait. Life does not look back. A week is more than enough time for us to decide whether or not to accept our destiny.

quotes.author: Mark Twain
quotes.quote: Kindness is a language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.

quotes.author: Charles Lamb
quotes.book: The Life, Letters and Writings of Charles Lamb
quotes.quote: Tis the privilege of friendship to talk nonsense, and to have her nonsense respected.

quotes.author: Robert A. Heinlein
quotes.quote: Happiness consists in getting enough sleep. Just that, nothing more.

quotes.author: Douglas Adams
quotes.book: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
quotes.quote: The ships hung in the sky in much the same way that bricks don't.

quotes.author: Hermann Hesse
quotes.book: Demian. Die Geschichte von Emil Sinclairs Jugend
quotes.quote: If you hate a person, you hate something in him that is part of yourself. What isn't part of ourselves doesn't disturb us.

quotes.author: Barack Obama
quotes.quote: Change will not come if we wait for some other person, or if we wait for some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek.

quotes.author: William Shakespeare
quotes.quote: My bounty is as boundless as the sea,My love as deep; the more I give to thee,The more I have, for both are infinite.

quotes.author: Thomas Wolfe
quotes.quote: Make your mistakes, take your chances, look silly, but keep on going. Don't freeze up.

quotes.author: Rick Riordan
quotes.quote: Go on with what your heart tells you, or you will lose all.

quotes.author: Sylvia Plath
quotes.quote: If neurotic is wanting two mutually exclusive things at one and the same time, then I'm neurotic as hell. I'll be flying back and forth between one mutually exclusive thing and another for the rest of my days.

quotes.author: Jon Krakauer
quotes.quote: It's not always necessary to be strong, but to feel strong.

quotes.author: John Green
quotes.quote: Have you really read all those books in your room?

quotes.author: Pablo Neruda
quotes.quote: Sonnet XVIII do not love you as if you were salt-rose, or topaz,or the arrow of carnations the fire shoots off.I love you as certain dark things are to be loved,in secret, between the shadow and the soul.I love you as the plant that never bloomsbut carries in itself the light of hidden flowers;thanks to your love a certain solid fragrance,risen from the earth, lives darkly in my body.I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where.I love you straightforwardly, without complexities or pride;so I love you because I know no other way than this: where I does not exist, nor you,so close that your hand on my chest is my hand,so close that your eyes close as I fall asleep.

quotes.author: Fannie Flagg
quotes.book: Fried Green Tomatoes at the Whistle Stop Cafe
quotes.quote: Remember if people talk behind your back, it only means you are two steps ahead.

quotes.author: Charles Bukowski
quotes.quote: I will remember the kisses our lips raw with love and how you gave me everything you had and how I offered you what was left of me, and I will remember your small room the feel of you the light in the window your records your books our morning coffee our noons our nights our bodies spilled together sleeping the tiny flowing currents immediate and forever your leg my leg your arm my arm your smile and the warmth of you who made me laugh again.

quotes.author: Richelle Mead
quotes.quote: The only thing better than imagining Dimitri carrying me in his arms was imagining him shirtless while carrying me in his arms.

quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quotes.quote: Make your own Bible. Select and collect all the words and sentences that in all your readings have been to you like the blast of a trumpet.

quotes.author: Maya Angelou
quotes.quote: Never make someone a priority when all you are to them is an option.

quotes.author: Bill Watterson
quotes.quote: You know, Hobbes, some days even my lucky rocket ship underpants don't help.

quotes.author: Sylvia Plath
quotes.quote: Remember, remember, this is now, and now, and now. Live it, feel it, cling to it. I want to become acutely aware of all I've taken for granted.

quotes.author: John Updike
quotes.book: My Father's Tears and Other Stories
quotes.quote: It is easy to love people in memory; the hard thing is to love them when they are there in front of you.

quotes.author: Lemony Snicket
quotes.quote: Love can change a person the way a parent can change a baby- awkwardly, and often with a great deal of mess.

quotes.author: Vladimir Nabokov
quotes.quote: Lolita, light of my life, fire of my loins. My sin, my soul. Lo-lee-ta: the tip of the tongue taking a trip of three steps down the palate to tap, at three, on the teeth. Lo. Lee. Ta. She was Lo, plain Lo, in the morning, standing four feet ten in one sock. She was Lola in slacks. She was Dolly at school. She was Dolores on the dotted line. But in my arms she was always Lolita. Did she have a precursor? She did, indeed she did. In point of fact, there might have been no Lolita at all had I not loved, one summer, an initial girl-child. In a princedom by the sea. Oh when? About as many years before Lolita was born as my age was that summer. You can always count on a murderer for a fancy prose style. Ladies and gentlemen of the jury, exhibit number one is what the seraphs, the misinformed, simple, noble-winged seraphs, envied. Look at this tangle of thorns.

quotes.author: Ben Okri
quotes.quote: Stories can conquer fear, you know. They can make the heart bigger.

quotes.author: Octavia Butler
quotes.quote: In order to riseFrom its own ashesA phoenixFirstMustBurn.

quotes.author: Sylvia Plath
quotes.book: The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath
quotes.quote: Yes, I was infatuated with you: I am still. No one has ever heightened such a keen capacity of physical sensation in me. I cut you out because I couldn't stand being a passing fancy. Before I give my body, I must give my thoughts, my mind, my dreams. And you weren't having any of those.

quotes.author: Brian Jacques
quotes.quote: Even the strongest and bravest must sometimes weep. It shows they have a great heart, one that can feel compassion for others.

quotes.author: Robert Frost
quotes.quote: If we couldn't laugh we would all go insane.

quotes.author: Rumi
quotes.quote: Raise your words, not voice. It is rain that grows flowers, not thunder.

quotes.author: Edgar Allan Poe
quotes.quote: Believe nothing you hear, and only one half that you see.

quotes.author: Coco Chanel
quotes.quote: Don't spend time beating on a wall, hoping to transform it into a door.

quotes.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
quotes.book: Translations from the Poetry of Rainer Maria Rilke
quotes.quote: We need, in love, to practice only this: letting each other go. For holding on comes easily; we do not need to learn it.

quotes.author: Mitch Albom
quotes.quote: Lost love is still love. It takes a different form, that's all. You can't see their smile or bring them food or tousle their hair or move them around a dance floor. But when those senses weaken another heightens. Memory. Memory becomes your partner. You nurture it. You hold it. You dance with it.

quotes.author: John Steinbeck
quotes.quote: And now that you don't have to be perfect, you can be good.

quotes.author: Stanislaw Lem
quotes.quote: Good books tell the truth, even when they're about things that never have been and never will be. They're truthful in a different way.

quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.
quotes.quote: Nothing in the world is more dangerous than sincere ignorance and conscientious stupidity.

quotes.author: Suzanne Collins
quotes.quote: I must have loved you a lot.

quotes.author: Veronica Roth
quotes.quote: It must require bravery to be honest all the time.

quotes.author: Marissa Meyer
quotes.quote: Even in the Future the Story Begins with Once Upon a Time.

quotes.author: Veronica Roth
quotes.quote: There are so many ways to be brave in this world. Sometimes bravery involves laying down your life for something bigger than yourself, or for someone else. Sometimes it involves giving up everything you have ever known, or everyone you have ever loved, for the sake of something greater.But sometimes it doesn't.Sometimes it is nothing more than gritting your teeth through pain, and the work of every day, the slow walk toward a better life. That is the sort of bravery I must have now.

quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks
quotes.quote: The reason it hurts so much to separate is because our souls are connected. Maybe they always have been and will be. Maybe we've lived a thousand lives before this one and in each of them we've found each other. And maybe each time, we've been forced apart for the same reasons. That means that this goodbye is both a goodbye for the past ten thousand years and a prelude to what will come.

quotes.author: Adrienne Rich
quotes.quote: There must be those among whom we can sit down and weep and still be counted as warriors.

quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk
quotes.quote: You are not your job, you're not how much money you have in the bank. You are not the car you drive. You're not the contents of your wallet. You are not your fucking khakis. You are all singing, all dancing crap of the world.

quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett
quotes.quote: Attitude is a choice. Happiness is a choice. Optimism is a choice. Kindness is a choice. Giving is a choice. Respect is a choice. Whatever choice you make makes you. Choose wisely.

quotes.author: Maya Angelou
quotes.book: Phenomenal Woman: Four Poems Celebrating Women
quotes.quote: Pretty women wonder where my secret lies.I'm not cute or built to suit a fashion model's sizeBut when I start to tell them,They think I'm telling lies.I say,It's in the reach of my armsThe span of my hips,The stride of my step,The curl of my lips.I'm a womanPhenomenally.Phenomenal woman,That's me.

quotes.author: Jack Kerouac
quotes.quote: I like too many things and get all confused and hung-up running from one falling star to another till i drop. This is the night, what it does to you. I had nothing to offer anybody except my own confusion.

quotes.author: A.A. Milne
quotes.quote: What day is it?

quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy
quotes.quote: Respect was invented to cover the empty place where love should be.

quotes.author: William Shakespeare
quotes.quote: By the pricking of my thumbs, Something wicked this way comes.

quotes.author: Nikolai V. Gogol
quotes.quote: The longer and more carefully we look at a funny story, the sadder it becomes.

quotes.author: George R.R. Martin
quotes.quote: When you play a game of thrones you win or you die.

quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk
quotes.quote: You know how they say you only hurt the ones you love? Well, it works both ways.

quotes.author: Charles Bukowski
quotes.quote: I felt like crying but nothing came out. it was just a sort of sad sickness, sick sad, when you can't feel any worse. I think you know it. I think everybody knows it now and then. but I think I have known it pretty often, too often.

quotes.author: W.C. Fields
quotes.quote: It ain't what they call you, it's what you answer to.

quotes.author: Oscar Wilde
quotes.quote: There is only one thing in the world worse than being talked about, and that is not being talked about.

quotes.author: Jean de La Fontaine
quotes.quote: Rare as is true love, true friendship is rarer.

quotes.author: Peter Shaffer
quotes.quote: The trouble is if you don't spend your life yourself, other people spend it for you.

quotes.author: Richelle Mead
quotes.quote: Did you see that dress?

quotes.author: Susan Sontag
quotes.book: As Consciousness is Harnessed to Flesh: Journals and Notebooks, 1964-1980
quotes.quote: My library is an archive of longings.

quotes.author: Michelle Hodkin
quotes.quote: Thinking something does not make it true. Wanting something does not make it real.

quotes.author: Mitch Albom
quotes.book: The Five People You Meet in Heaven
quotes.quote: All parents damage their children. It cannot be helped. Youth, like pristine glass, absorbs the prints of its handlers.

quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi
quotes.quote: You must not lose faith in humanity. Humanity is like an ocean; if a few drops of the ocean are dirty, the ocean does not become dirty.

quotes.author: Julian Barnes
quotes.quote: This was another of our fears: that Life wouldn't turn out to be like Literature.

quotes.author: Margaret Atwood
quotes.quote: A word after a word after a word is power.

quotes.author: Maya Angelou
quotes.quote: You can only become truly accomplished at something you love. Don't make money your goal. Instead pursue the things you love doing and then do them so well that people can't take their eyes off of you.

quotes.author: Plato
quotes.quote: Only the dead have seen the end of war.

quotes.author: Daniel Defoe
quotes.quote: It is never too late to be wise.

quotes.author: Pablo Picasso
quotes.quote: Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.

quotes.author: Patrick Rothfuss
quotes.quote: Perhaps the greatest faculty our minds possess is the ability to cope with pain. Classic thinking teaches us of the four doors of the mind, which everyone moves through according to their need.First is the door of sleep. Sleep offers us a retreat from the world and all its pain. Sleep marks passing time, giving us distance from the things that have hurt us. When a person is wounded they will often fall unconscious. Similarly, someone who hears traumatic news will often swoon or faint. This is the mind's way of protecting itself from pain by stepping through the first door.Second is the door of forgetting. Some wounds are too deep to heal, or too deep to heal quickly. In addition, many memories are simply painful, and there is no healing to be done. The saying 'time heals all wounds' is false. Time heals most wounds. The rest are hidden behind this door.Third is the door of madness. There are times when the mind is dealt such a blow it hides itself in insanity. While this may not seem beneficial, it is. There are times when reality is nothing but pain, and to escape that pain the mind must leave reality behind. Last is the door of death. The final resort. Nothing can hurt us after we are dead, or so we have been told.

quotes.author: John Green
quotes.quote: You like someone who can't like you back because unrequited love can be survived in a way that once-requited love cannot.

quotes.author: Sarah Dessen
quotes.quote: Anyone can hide. Facing up to things, working through them, that's what makes you strong.

quotes.author: Bob Marley
quotes.quote: The greatness of a man is not in how much wealth he acquires, but in his integrity and his ability to affect those around him positively

quotes.author: George Eliot
quotes.quote: What do we live for, if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?

quotes.author: Arrigo Boito
quotes.quote: When I saw you I fell in love, and you smiled because you knew.

quotes.author: Margaret Mitchell
quotes.quote: Burdens are for shoulders strong enough to carry them.

quotes.author: Anne Sexton
quotes.quote: As it has been said:Love and a coughcannot be concealed.Even a small cough.Even a small love.

quotes.author: Elie Wiesel
quotes.quote: Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.

quotes.author: Aung San Suu Kyi
quotes.quote: The only real prison is fear, and the only real freedom is freedom from fear

quotes.author: Phyllis Diller
quotes.quote: A smile is a curve that sets everything straight.

quotes.author: Oscar Wilde
quotes.quote: I have the simplest tastes. I am always satisfied with the best.

quotes.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
quotes.quote: Little by little, one travels far

quotes.author: Boris Pasternak
quotes.quote: I don't like people who have never fallen or stumbled. Their virtue is lifeless and it isn't of much value. Life hasn't revealed its beauty to them.

quotes.author: Cassandra Clare
quotes.quote: My rapier wit hides my inner pain.

quotes.author: L.M. Montgomery
quotes.quote: Kindred spirits are not so scarce as I used to think. It's splendid to find out there are so many of them in the world.

quotes.author: Evelyn Waugh
quotes.book: Brideshead Revisited: The Sacred and Profane Memories of Captain Charles Ryder
quotes.quote: Sometimes, I feel the past and the future pressing so hard on either side that there's no room for the present at all.

quotes.author: Gail Carson Levine
quotes.quote: A library is infinity under a roof.

quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks
quotes.quote: I fell in love with her when we were together, then fell deeper in love with her in the years we were apart.

quotes.author: Thomas Paine
quotes.book: A Letter Addressed to the Abbe Raynal on the Affairs of North America
quotes.quote: The mind once enlightened cannot again become dark.

quotes.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
quotes.book: Travels with a Donkey in the Cevennes
quotes.quote: I travel not to go anywhere, but to go. I travel for travel's sake. The great affair is to move.

quotes.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
quotes.quote: Life is not a matter of holding good cards, but of playing a poor hand well.

quotes.author: Gustave Flaubert
quotes.quote: Do not read as children do to enjoy themselves, or, as the ambitious do to educate themselves. No, read to live.

quotes.author: Socrates
quotes.quote: There is only one good, knowledge, and one evil, ignorance.

quotes.author: Confucius
quotes.quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.

quotes.author: Tennessee Williams
quotes.quote: Time is the longest distance between two places.

quotes.author: Steve Jobs
quotes.quote: Remembering that you are going to die is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose. You are already naked. There is no reason not to follow your heart.

quotes.author: John Muir
quotes.quote: When one tugs at a single thing in nature, he finds it attached to the rest of the world.

quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quotes.quote: No one can construct for you the bridge upon which precisely you must cross the stream of life, no one but you yourself alone.

quotes.author: Terry Pratchett
quotes.quote: Light thinks it travels faster than anything but it is wrong. No matter how fast light travels, it finds the darkness has always got there first, and is waiting for it.

quotes.author: Khaled Hosseini
quotes.quote: There is only one sin. and that is theft... when you tell a lie, you steal someones right to the truth.

quotes.author: Julia Child
quotes.quote: A party without cake is just a meeting

quotes.author: Suzanne Collins
quotes.quote: You're a painter. You're a baker. You like to sleep with the windows open. You never take sugar in your tea. And you always double-knot your shoelaces.

quotes.author: Jamie McGuire
quotes.quote: I know we're fucked up, alright? I'm impulsive, and hot tempered, and you get under my skin like no one else. You act like you hate me one minute, and then need me the next. I never get anything right, and I don't deserve you...but I fucking love you, Abby. I love you more than I loved anyone or anything ever. When you're around, I don't need booze, or money, or the fighting, or the one-night stands...

quotes.author: Neil LaBute
quotes.quote: The future is now. It's time to grow up and be strong. Tomorrow may well be too late.

quotes.author: Stieg Larsson
quotes.book: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
quotes.quote: What she had realized was that love was that moment when your heart was about to burst.

quotes.author: Audrey Hepburn
quotes.quote: If I'm honest I have to tell you I still read fairy-tales and I like them best of all.

quotes.author: Sophocles
quotes.quote: One wordFrees us of all the weight and pain of life:That word is love.

quotes.author: Glen Cook
quotes.quote: Morning is wonderful. Its only drawback is that it comes at such an inconvenient time of day.

quotes.author: William Goldman
quotes.quote: When I was your age, television was called books.

quotes.author: T.S. Eliot
quotes.quote: Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.

quotes.author: Cornelia Funke
quotes.quote: Books have to be heavy because the whole world's inside them.

quotes.author: Anthony Powell
quotes.quote: I get a warm feeling among my books.

quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway
quotes.quote: When people talk, listen completely. Most people never listen.

quotes.author: P.C. Cast Kristin Cast
quotes.quote: If you have good friends, no matter how much life is sucking , they can make you laugh.

quotes.author: Rumi
quotes.book: Masnavi i Man'avi, the spiritual couplets of Maula
quotes.quote: Sell your cleverness and buy bewilderment.

quotes.author: Charles Lamb
quotes.quote: I always arrive late at the office, but I make up for it by leaving early.

quotes.author: C.S. Lewis
quotes.quote: You can make anything by writing.

quotes.author: Stephen Chbosky
quotes.book: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
quotes.quote: And all the books you've read have been read by other people. And all the songs you've loved have been heard by other people. And that girl that's pretty to you is pretty to other people. and that if you looked at these facts when you were happy, you would feel great because you are describing 'unity.

quotes.author: Karen Blixen
quotes.quote: I know of a cure for everything: salt water...in one way or the other. Sweat, or tears, or the salt sea.

quotes.author: Lauren Oliver
quotes.quote: I'd rather die my way than live yours.

quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
quotes.quote: You see I usually find myself among strangers because I drift here and there trying to forget the sad things that happened to me.

quotes.author: J. K. Rowling
quotes.book: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
quotes.quote: What happened down in the dungeons between you and Professor Quirrell is a complete secret, so, naturally the whole school knows.

quotes.author: Jo Walton
quotes.quote: It doesn't matter. I have books, new books, and I can bear anything as long as there are books.

quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quotes.quote: The snake which cannot cast its skin has to die. As well the minds which are prevented from changing their opinions; they cease to be mind.

quotes.author: Marilyn Monroe
quotes.quote: Sometimes things fall apart so that better things can fall together

quotes.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
quotes.quote: Let everything happen to youBeauty and terrorJust keep goingNo feeling is final

quotes.author: Mother Teresa
quotes.quote: Do not think that love in order to be genuine has to be extraordinary. What we need is to love without getting tired. Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.

quotes.author: Kurt Vonnegut
quotes.quote: Of all the words of mice and men, the saddest are, "It might have been."

quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk
quotes.quote: No matter how careful you are, there's going to be the sense you missed something, the collapsed feeling under your skin that you didn't experience it all. There's that fallen heart feeling that you rushed right through the moments where you should've been paying attention.Well, get used to that feeling. That's how your whole life will feel some day.This is all practice.

quotes.author: George Carlin
quotes.quote: Never underestimate the power of stupid people in large groups.

quotes.author: Michael Crichton
quotes.quote: If you don't know history, then you don't know anything. You are a leaf that doesn't know it is part of a tree.

quotes.author: Socrates
quotes.quote: I cannot teach anybody anything. I can only make them think

quotes.author: Anne Frank
quotes.book: diary of Anne Frank: the play
quotes.quote: No one has ever become poor by giving.

quotes.author: Christopher Hitchens
quotes.book: The Portable Atheist: Essential Readings for the Nonbeliever
quotes.quote: Owners of dogs will have noticed that, if you provide them with food and water and shelter and affection, they will think you are god. Whereas owners of cats are compelled to realize that, if you provide them with food and water and shelter and affection, they draw the conclusion that they are gods.

quotes.author: Mark Twain
quotes.quote: It's not the size of the dog in the fight, it's the size of the fight in the dog.

quotes.author: Charles Bukowski
quotes.quote: the free soul is rare, but you know it when you see it - basically because you feel good, very good, when you are near or with them.

quotes.author: Heinrich Heine
quotes.quote: Where words leave off, music begins.

quotes.author: Rita Mae Brown
quotes.quote: Sorrow is how we learn to love. Your heart isn't breaking. It hurts because it's getting larger. The larger it gets, the more love it holds.

quotes.author: Edward Abbey
quotes.quote: Better a cruel truth than a comfortable delusion.

quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln
quotes.quote: My concern is not whether God is on our side; my greatest concern is to be on God's side, for God is always right.

quotes.author: Jim Butcher
quotes.quote: When everything goes to hell, the people who stand by you without flinching -- they are your family.

quotes.author: Jack Kornfield
quotes.quote: In the endthese things matter most:How well did you love?How fully did you live?How deeply did you let go?

quotes.author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel
quotes.quote: Nothing great in the world was accomplished without passion.

quotes.author: V. S. Naipaul
quotes.quote: The only lies for which we are truly punished are those we tell ourselves.

quotes.author: Ray Bradbury
quotes.quote: You must write every single day of your life... You must lurk in libraries and climb the stacks like ladders to sniff books like perfumes and wear books like hats upon your crazy heads... may you be in love every day for the next 20,000 days. And out of that love, remake a world.

quotes.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
quotes.quote: The love of learning, the sequestered nooks,And all the sweet serenity of books

quotes.author: Laini Taylor
quotes.quote: Hope can be a powerful force. Maybe there's no actual magic in it, but when you know what you hope for most and hold it like a light within you, you can make things happen, almost like magic.

quotes.author: Lemony Snicket
quotes.quote: Strange as it may seem, I still hope for the best, even though the best, like an interesting piece of mail, so rarely arrives, and even when it does it can be lost so easily.

quotes.author: Ray Bradbury
quotes.quote: Everyone must leave something behind when he dies, my grandfather said. A child or a book or a painting or a house or a wall built or a pair of shoes made. Or a garden planted. Something your hand touched some way so your soul has somewhere to go when you die, and when people look at that tree or that flower you planted, you're there. It doesn't matter what you do, he said, so long as you change something from the way it was before you touched it into something that's like you after you take your hands away. The difference between the man who just cuts lawns and a real gardener is in the touching, he said. The lawn-cutter might just as well not have been there at all; the gardener will be there a lifetime.

quotes.author: Oscar Wilde
quotes.quote: I am too fond of reading books to care to write them.

quotes.author: Paulo Coelho
quotes.quote: Tears are words that need to be written.

quotes.author: Emilie Autumn
quotes.book: The Asylum for Wayward Victorian Girls
quotes.quote: It gives me strength to have somebody to fight for; I can never fight for myself, but, for others, I can kill.

quotes.author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti
quotes.quote: If you're too open-minded; your brains will fall out.

quotes.author: Rumi
quotes.quote: silence is the language of god, all else is poor translation.

quotes.author: Anne Rice
quotes.quote: You do have a story inside you; it lies articulate and waiting to be written - behind your silence and your suffering.

quotes.author: Mother Teresa
quotes.quote: Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.

quotes.author: Jodi Picoult
quotes.quote: If you have a sister and she dies, do you stop saying you have one? Or are you always a sister, even when the other half of the equation is gone?

quotes.author: Dante Alighieri
quotes.quote: Do not be afraid; our fateCannot be taken from us; it is a gift.

quotes.author: Ransom Riggs
quotes.book: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
quotes.quote: I used to dream about escaping my ordinary life, but my life was never ordinary. I had simply failed to notice how extraordinary it was.

quotes.author: Stephen King
quotes.quote: I think that we're all mentally ill. Those of us outside the asylums only hide it a little better - and maybe not all that much better after all.

quotes.author: Neil Gaiman
quotes.quote: Being a writer is a very peculiar sort of a job: it's always you versus a blank sheet of paper (or a blank screen) and quite often the blank piece of paper wins.

quotes.author: Joyce Carol Oates
quotes.quote: Reading is the sole means by which we slip, involuntarily, often helplessly, into another's skin, another's voice, another's soul.

quotes.author: Dr. Seuss
quotes.quote: Remember me and smile, for it's better to forget than to remember me and cry.

quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi
quotes.quote: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.

quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk
quotes.quote: When we don't know who to hate, we hate ourselves.

quotes.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
quotes.quote: I kept always two books in my pocket, one to read, one to write in.

quotes.author: Charles Bukowski
quotes.quote: those who escape hellhowevernever talk aboutitand nothing muchbothers themafterthat.

quotes.author: Sun Tzu
quotes.quote: Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak.

quotes.author: Frances Hodgson Burnett
quotes.quote: If you look the right way, you can see that the whole world is a garden.

quotes.author: Stieg Larsson
quotes.book: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
quotes.quote: Friendship- my definition- is built on two things. Respect and trust. Both elements have to be there. And it has to be mutual. You can have respect for someone, but if you don't have trust, the friendship will crumble.

quotes.author: Carol Shields
quotes.quote: Open a book this minute and start reading. Don't move until you've reached page fifty. Until you've buried your thoughts in print. Cover yourself with words. Wash yourself away. Dissolve.

quotes.author: Steve Martin
quotes.quote: Some people have a way with words, and other people...oh, uh, not have way.

quotes.author: Blaise Pascal
quotes.quote: The heart has its reasons which reason knows not.

quotes.author: Arundhati Roy
quotes.quote: That's what careless words do. They make people love you a little less.

quotes.author: J.K. Rowling
quotes.quote: The last enemy that shall be destroyed is death.

quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln
quotes.quote: I'm a success today because I had a friend who believed in me and I didn't have the heart to let him down.

quotes.author: Yann Martel
quotes.quote: To choose doubt as a philosophy of life is akin to choosing immobility as a means of transportation.

quotes.author: Pablo Neruda
quotes.quote: so I wait for you like a lonely housetill you will see me again and live in me.Till then my windows ache.

quotes.author: Maya Angelou
quotes.quote: A woman's heart should be so hidden in God that a man has to seek Him just to find her.

quotes.author: Laurell K. Hamilton
quotes.quote: I will love you always. When this red hair is white, I will still love you. When the smooth softness of youth is replaced by the delicate softness of age, I will still want to touch your skin. When your face is full of the lines of every smile you have ever smiled, of every surprise I have seen flash through your eyes, when every tear you have ever cried has left its mark upon your face,I will treasure you all the more, because I was there to see it all. I will share your life with you, Meredith, and I will love you until the last breath leaves your body or mine.

quotes.author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón
quotes.quote: Every book, every volume you see here, has a soul. The soul of the person who wrote it and of those who read it and lived and dreamed with it. Every time a book changes hands, every time someone runs his eyes down its pages, its spirit grows and strengthens.

quotes.author: Agatha Christie
quotes.quote: Very few of us are what we seem.

quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks
quotes.quote: I have faith that God will show you the answer. But you have to understand that sometimes it takes a while to be able to recognize what God wants you to do. That's how it often is. God's voice is usually nothing more than a whisper, and you have to listen very carefully to hear it. But other times, in those rarest of moments, the answer is obvious and rings as loud as a church bell.

quotes.author: Groucho Marx
quotes.quote: Learn from the mistakes of others. You can never live long enough to make them all yourself.

quotes.author: Rebecca West
quotes.quote: I myself have never been able to find out precisely what feminism is: I only know that people call me a feminist whenever I express sentiments that differentiate me from a doormat.

quotes.author: Terry Pratchett
quotes.quote: It's not worth doing something unless someone, somewhere, would much rather you weren't doing it.

quotes.author: Alex Haley
quotes.quote: Either you deal with what is the reality, or you can be sure that the reality is going to deal with you.

quotes.author: Anais Nin
quotes.quote: I am only responsible for my own heart, you offered yours up for the smashing my darling. Only a fool would give out such a vital organ

quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks
quotes.quote: you have to love something before you can hate it.

quotes.author: Daniel J. Boorstin
quotes.quote: The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.

quotes.author: Jasper Fforde
quotes.quote: If the real world were a book, it would never find a publisher. Overlong, detailed to the point of distraction-and ultimately, without a major resolution.

quotes.author: Neil Gaiman
quotes.quote: [D]on't ever apologise to an author for buying something in paperback, or taking it out from a library (that's what they're there for. Use your library). Don't apologise to this author for buying books second hand, or getting them from bookcrossing or borrowing a friend's copy. What's important to me is that people read the books and enjoy them, and that, at some point in there, the book was bought by someone. And that people who like things, tell other people. The most important thing is that people read...

quotes.author: Tim Burton
quotes.quote: One person's craziness is another person's reality.

quotes.author: T.S. Eliot
quotes.quote: This is the way the world endsNot with a bang but a whimper.

quotes.author: Albert Schweitzer
quotes.quote: There are two means of refuge from the misery of life - music and cats.

quotes.author: Nicole Krauss
quotes.quote: When will you learn that there isn't a word for everything?

quotes.author: Honoré de Balzac
quotes.quote: The more one judges, the less one loves.

quotes.author: George S. Patton
quotes.quote: If everybody is thinking alike, then somebody isn't thinking.

quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks
quotes.quote: I love you, not just for now, but for always, and I dream of the day that you'll take me in your arms again.

quotes.author: Phyllis McGinley
quotes.quote: A bit of trash now and then is good for the severest reader. It provides the necessary roughage in the literary diet.

quotes.author: Sarah Dessen
quotes.quote: What is family? They were the people who claimed you. In good, in bad, in parts or in whole, they were the ones who showed up, who stayed in there, regardless. It wasn't just about blood relations or shared chromosomes, but something wider, bigger. We had many families over time. Our family of origin, the family we created, and the groups you moved through while all of this was happening: friends, lovers, sometimes even strangers. None of them perfect, and we couldn't expect them to be. You can't make any one person your world. The trick was to take what each could give you and build your world from it.

quotes.author: Dante Alighieri
quotes.quote: My course is set for an uncharted sea.

quotes.author: jonathan safran foer
quotes.quote: Time was passing like a hand waving from a train I wanted to be on. I hope you never have to think about anything as much as I think about you.

quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
quotes.quote: It takes courage to love, but pain through love is the purifying fire which those who love generously know. We all know people who are so much afraid of pain that they shut themselves up like clams in a shell and, giving out nothing, receive nothing and therefore shrink until life is a mere living death.

quotes.author: Lemony Snicket
quotes.quote: It is one of life's bitterest truths that bedtime so often arrives just when things are really getting interesting.

quotes.author: Christopher Hitchens
quotes.quote: That which can be asserted without evidence, can be dismissed without evidence.

quotes.author: J.M. Barrie
quotes.quote: When the first baby laughed for the first time, its laugh broke into a thousand pieces, and they all went skipping about, and that was the beginning of fairies.

quotes.author: Rick Riordan
quotes.quote: Knowing too much of your future is never a good thing.

quotes.author: Randy Pausch
quotes.quote: The brick walls are there for a reason. The brick walls are not there to keep us out. The brick walls are there to give us a chance to show how badly we want something. Because the brick walls are there to stop the people who don't want it badly enough. They're there to stop the other people.

quotes.author: Hunter S. Thompson
quotes.quote: I hate to advocate drugs, alcohol, violence, or insanity to anyone, but they've always worked for me.

quotes.author: Steve Maraboli
quotes.quote: Cry. Forgive. Learn. Move on. Let your tears water the seeds of your future happiness.

quotes.author: Lauren Oliver
quotes.quote: I guess that's just part of loving people: You have to give things up. Sometimes you even have to give them up.

quotes.author: Viktor E. Frankl
quotes.quote: When we are no longer able to change a situation, we are challenged to change ourselves.

quotes.author: Stephen Chbosky
quotes.book: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
quotes.quote: please believe that things are good with me, and even when they're not, they will be soon enough. And i will always believe the same about you.

quotes.author: Charlotte Brontë
quotes.quote: The trouble is not that I am single and likely to stay single, but that I am lonely and likely to stay lonely.

quotes.author: Maya Angelou
quotes.quote: You may encounter many defeats, but you must not be defeated. In fact, it may be necessary to encounter the defeats, so you can know who you are, what you can rise from, how you can still come out of it.

quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks
quotes.quote: The emotion that can break your heart is sometimes the very one that heals it...

quotes.author: Bob Dylan
quotes.quote: Behind every beautiful thing, there's some kind of pain.

quotes.author: Kate Chopin
quotes.quote: The voice of the sea speaks to the soul.

quotes.author: Hal Borland
quotes.quote: No winter lasts forever; no spring skips its turn.

quotes.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
quotes.quote: Courage is found in unlikely places.

quotes.author: Lorraine Hansberry
quotes.quote: The thing that makes you exceptional, if you are at all, is inevitably that which must also make you lonely.

quotes.author: Kurt Vonnegut
quotes.quote: How nice -- to feel nothing, and still get full credit for being alive.

quotes.author: Peter S. Beagle
quotes.quote: Great heroes need great sorrows and burdens, or half their greatness goes unnoticed. It is all part of the fairy tale.

quotes.author: Sarah J. Maas
quotes.quote: We all bear scars,... Mine just happen to be more visible than most.

quotes.author: J.D. Salinger
quotes.quote: I am always saying "Glad to've met you" to somebody I'm not at all glad I met. If you want to stay alive, you have to say that stuff, though.

quotes.author: John Lennon
quotes.quote: There's nowhere you can be that isn't where you're meant to be...

quotes.author: Edgar Allan Poe
quotes.quote: From childhood's hour I have not been. As others were, I have not seen. As others saw, I could not awaken. My heart to joy at the same tone. And all I loved, I loved alone.

quotes.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay
quotes.quote: Where you used to be, there is a hole in the world, which I find myself constantly walking around in the daytime, and falling in at night. I miss you like hell.

quotes.author: Rainbow Rowell
quotes.quote: Holding Eleanor's hand was like holding a butterfly. Or a heartbeat. Like holding something complete, and completely alive.

quotes.author: Cassandra Clare
quotes.quote: You might want to lie down. I find that it helps when the crushing sense of horrible realization sets in.

quotes.author: J.K. Rowling
quotes.quote: We do not need magic to transform our world. We carry all of the power we need inside ourselves already.

quotes.author: Mae West
quotes.quote: Between two evils, I always pick the one I never tried before.

quotes.author: E. E. Cummings
quotes.quote: Trust your heart if the seas catch fire, live by love though the stars walk backward.

quotes.author: Reginald Vincent Holmes
quotes.quote: The earth has its music for those who will listen

quotes.author: Pittacus Lore
quotes.quote: When you have lost hope, you have lost everything. And when you think all is lost, when all is dire and bleak, there is always hope.

quotes.author: Louise Erdrich
quotes.quote: When we are young, the words are scattered all around us. As they are assembled by experience, so also are we, sentence by sentence, until the story takes shape.

quotes.author: Dr. Seuss
quotes.quote: They say I'm old-fashioned, and live in the past, but sometimes I think progress progresses too fast!

quotes.author: Anne Rice
quotes.quote: Evil is always possible. And goodness is eternally difficult.

quotes.author: Emily Brontë
quotes.quote: I wish I were a girl again, half-savage and hardy, and free.

quotes.author: Maya Angelou
quotes.quote: Try to be a rainbow in someone's cloud.

quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk
quotes.quote: You are not special. You're not a beautiful and unique snowflake. You're the same decaying organic matter as everything else. We're all part of the same compost heap. We're all singing, all dancing crap of the world.

quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.
quotes.quote: The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience, but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy.

quotes.author: Lewis Carroll
quotes.quote: Curiouser and curiouser!

quotes.author: Bob Marley
quotes.quote: Better to die fighting for freedom then be a prisoner all the days of your life.

quotes.author: Langston Hughes
quotes.quote: Let the rain kiss you. Let the rain beat upon your head with silver liquid drops. Let the rain sing you a lullaby.

quotes.author: Guy de Maupassant
quotes.quote: Words dazzle and deceive because they are mimed by the face. But black words on a white page are the soul laid bare.

quotes.author: Charles Darwin
quotes.quote: If I had my life to live over again, I would have made a rule to read some poetry and listen to some music at least once every week.

quotes.author: Mark Twain
quotes.quote: I've lived through some terrible things in my life, some of which actually happened.

quotes.author: L. M. Montgomery
quotes.quote: I'm so glad I live in a world where there are Octobers.

quotes.author: Paulo Coelho
quotes.quote: If I am really a part of your dream, you'll come back one day.

quotes.author: James Baldwin
quotes.quote: Children have never been very good at listening to their elders, but they have never failed to imitate them.

quotes.author: Anais Nin
quotes.quote: I am lonely, yet not everybody will do. I don't know why, some people fill the gaps and others emphasize my loneliness. In reality those who satisfy me are those who simply allow me to live with my ''idea of them.

quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
quotes.quote: There are only the pursued, the pursuing, the busy and the tired.

quotes.author: Tom Robbins
quotes.quote: When we're incomplete, we're always searching for somebody to complete us. When, after a few years or a few months of a relationship, we find that we're still unfulfilled, we blame our partners and take up with somebody more promising. This can go on and on--series polygamy--until we admit that while a partner can add sweet dimensions to our lives, we, each of us, are responsible for our own fulfillment. Nobody else can provide it for us, and to believe otherwise is to delude ourselves dangerously and to program for eventual failure every relationship we enter.

quotes.author: Harvey Fierstein
quotes.quote: Never be bullied into silence. Never allow yourself to be made a victim. Accept no one's definition of your life, but define yourself.

quotes.author: Lao Tsu
quotes.quote: Those who know do not speak. Those who speak do not know.

quotes.author: Tahereh Mafi
quotes.quote: Books are easily destroyed. But words will live as long as people can remember them.

quotes.author: Neil Gaiman
quotes.quote: Things need not have happened to be true. Tales and dreams are the shadow-truths that will endure when mere facts are dust and ashes, and forgot.

quotes.author: Oscar Wilde
quotes.quote: Selfishness is not living as one wishes to live, it is asking others to live as one wishes to live.

quotes.author: Woody Allen
quotes.quote: In my next life I want to live my life backwards. You start out dead and get that out of the way. Then you wake up in an old people's home feeling better every day. You get kicked out for being too healthy, go collect your pension, and then when you start work, you get a gold watch and a party on your first day. You work for 40 years until you're young enough to enjoy your retirement. You party, drink alcohol, and are generally promiscuous, then you are ready for high school. You then go to primary school, you become a kid, you play. You have no responsibilities, you become a baby until you are born. And then you spend your last 9 months floating in luxurious spa-like conditions with central heating and room service on tap, larger quarters every day and then Voila! You finish off as an orgasm!

quotes.author: J.R. Ward
quotes.quote: I was dead until you found me, though I breathed. I was sightless, though I could see. And then you came...and I was awakened.

quotes.author: James Joyce
quotes.quote: Shut your eyes and see.

quotes.author: Louisa May Alcott
quotes.quote: I like good strong words that mean something...

quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran
quotes.quote: Ever has it been that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.

quotes.author: Kurt Cobain
quotes.quote: I'd rather be hated for who I am, than loved for who I am not.

quotes.author: Sylvia Plath
quotes.quote: Is there no way out of the mind?

quotes.author: Thomas Babington Macaulay
quotes.book: The Selected Letters Of Thomas Babington Macaulay
quotes.quote: What a blessing it is to love books as I love them;- to be able to converse with the dead, and to live amidst the unreal!

quotes.author: Ashleigh Brilliant
quotes.quote: My life has a superb cast, but I cannot figure out the plot.

quotes.author: Henry James
quotes.quote: She feels in italics and thinks in CAPITALS.

quotes.author: Cassandra Clare
quotes.quote: Sometimes, when I have to do something I don't want to do, I pretend I'm a character from a book. It's easier to know what they would do.

quotes.author: Victor Hugo
quotes.quote: To put everything in balance is good, to put everything in harmony is better.

quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks
quotes.quote: We sit silently and watch the world around us. This has taken a lifetime to learn. It seems only the old are able to sit next to one another and not say anything and still feel content. The young, brash and impatient, must always break the silence. It is a waste, for silence is pure. Silence is holy. It draws people together because only those who are comfortable with each other can sit without speaking. This is the great paradox.

quotes.author: Joss Whedon
quotes.quote: I write to give myself strength. I write to be the characters that I am not. I write to explore all the things I'm afraid of.

quotes.author: Rick Riordan
quotes.quote: Even strength must bow to wisdom sometimes.

quotes.author: Haruki Murakami
quotes.quote: Lost opportunities, lost possibilities, feelings we can never get back. That's part of what it means to be alive. But inside our heads - at least that's where I imagine it - there's a little room where we store those memories. A room like the stacks in this library. And to understand the workings of our own heart we have to keep on making new reference cards. We have to dust things off every once in awhile, let in fresh air, change the water in the flower vases. In other words, you'll live forever in your own private library.

quotes.author: Richelle Mead
quotes.quote: You will lose what you value most, so treasure it while you can.

quotes.author: Johnny Depp
quotes.quote: If someone were to harm my family or a friend or somebody I love, I would eat them. I might end up in jail for 500 years, but I would eat them.

quotes.author: Kazuo Ishiguro
quotes.quote: Memories, even your most precious ones, fade surprisingly quickly. But I don't go along with that. The memories I value most, I don't ever see them fading.

quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi
quotes.quote: Let the first act of every morning be to make the following resolve for the day:- I shall not fear anyone on Earth. - I shall fear only God. - I shall not bear ill will toward anyone. - I shall not submit to injustice from anyone. - I shall conquer untruth by truth. And in resisting untruth, I shall put up with all suffering.

quotes.author: Alexandre Dumas
quotes.quote: I am not proud, but I am happy; and happiness blinds, I think, more than pride.

quotes.author: Patrick Rothfuss
quotes.quote: It's the questions we can't answer that teach us the most. They teach us how to think. If you give a man an answer, all he gains is a little fact. But give him a question and he'll look for his own answers.

quotes.author: Santosh Kalwar
quotes.quote: We are addicted to our thoughts. We cannot change anything if we cannot change our thinking.

quotes.author: Terry Pratchett
quotes.book: Good Omens: The Nice and Accurate Prophecies of Agnes Nutter, Witch
quotes.quote: DON'T THINK OF IT AS DYING, said Death. JUST THINK OF IT AS LEAVING EARLY TO AVOID THE RUSH.

quotes.author: R.A. Salvatore
quotes.quote: It is better, I think, to grab at the stars than to sit flustered because you know you cannot reach them.

quotes.author: Rene Descartes
quotes.quote: I think; therefore I am.

quotes.author: Sigmund Freud
quotes.quote: Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.

quotes.author: Neil Gaiman
quotes.quote: I hope you will have a wonderful year, that you'll dream dangerously and outrageously, that you'll make something that didn't exist before you made it, that you will be loved and that you will be liked, and that you will have people to love and to like in return. And, most importantly (because I think there should be more kindness and more wisdom in the world right now), that you will, when you need to be, be wise, and that you will always be kind.

quotes.author: Jonathan Safran Foer
quotes.quote: He awoke each morning with the desire to do right, to be a good and meaningful person, to be, as simple as it sounded and as impossible as it actually was, happy. And during the course of each day his heart would descend from his chest into his stomach. By early afternoon he was overcome by the feeling that nothing was right, or nothing was right for him, and by the desire to be alone. By evening he was fulfilled: alone in the magnitude of his grief, alone in his aimless guilt, alone even in his loneliness. I am not sad, he would repeat to himself over and over, I am not sad. As if he might one day convince himself. Or fool himself. Or convince others--the only thing worse than being sad is for others to know that you are sad. I am not sad. I am not sad. Because his life had unlimited potential for happiness, insofar as it was an empty white room. He would fall asleep with his heart at the foot of his bed, like some domesticated animal that was no part of him at all. And each morning he would wake with it again in the cupboard of his rib cage, having become a little heavier, a little weaker, but still pumping. And by the midafternoon he was again overcome with the desire to be somewhere else, someone else, someone else somewhere else. I am not sad.

quotes.author: Andy Warhol
quotes.quote: They always say time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.

quotes.author: Terry McMillan
quotes.quote: Too many of us are hung up on what we don't have, can't have, or won't ever have. We spend too much energy being down, when we could use that same energy – if not less of it – doing, or at least trying to do, some of the things we really want to do.

quotes.author: C. JoyBell C.
quotes.quote: Life is too short to waste any amount of time on wondering what other people think about you. In the first place, if they had better things going on in their lives, they wouldn't have the time to sit around and talk about you. What's important to me is not others' opinions of me, but what's important to me is my opinion of myself.

quotes.author: John Green
quotes.quote: And then something invisible snapped insider her, and that which had come together commenced to fall apart.

quotes.author: Dr. Seuss
quotes.quote: Only you can control your future.

quotes.author: Edmund Burke
quotes.quote: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.

quotes.author: Paulo Coelho
quotes.quote: Don't give in to your fears. If you do, you won't be able to talk to your heart.

quotes.author: Dr. Seuss
quotes.book: I Can Read With My Eyes Shut!
quotes.quote: You'll miss the best things if you keep your eyes shut.

quotes.author: Warsan Shire
quotes.quote: My alone feels so good, I'll only have you if you're sweeter than my solitude.

quotes.author: W.B. Yeats
quotes.quote: The world is full of magic things, patiently waiting for our senses to grow sharper.

quotes.author: Sean O'Casey
quotes.quote: Laughter is wine for the soul - laughter soft, or loud and deep, tinged through with seriousness - the hilarious declaration made by man that life is worth living.

quotes.author: Katharine Graham
quotes.quote: The longer I live, the more I observe that carrying around anger is the most debilitating to the person who bears it.

quotes.author: Richelle Mead
quotes.quote: I know how devastated you must be to miss me, but leave a message, and I'll try to ease your agony

quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy
quotes.quote: We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom.

quotes.author: Dr. Seuss
quotes.quote: If you never did you should. These things are fun and fun is good.

quotes.author: Marilyn Monroe
quotes.quote: All a girl really wants is for one guy to prove to her that they are not all the same.

quotes.author: Stephen Chbosky
quotes.book: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
quotes.quote: It's much easier to not know things sometimes. Things change and friends leave. And life doesn't stop for anybody. I wanted to laugh. Or maybe get mad. Or maybe shrug at how strange everybody was, especially me. I think the idea is that every person has to live for his or her own life and than make the choice to share it with other people. You can't just sit their and put everybody's lives ahead of yours and think that counts as love. You just can't. You have to do things. I'm going to do what I want to do. I'm going to be who I really am. And I'm going to figure out what that is. And we could all sit around and wonder and feel bad about each other and blame a lot of people for what they did or didn't do or what they didn't know. I don't know. I guess there could always be someone to blame. It's just different. Maybe it's good to put things in perspective, but sometimes, I think that the only perspective is to really be there. Because it's okay to feel things. I was really there. And that was enough to make me feel infinite. I feel infinite.

quotes.author: Carl Sagan
quotes.quote: The nitrogen in our DNA, the calcium in our teeth, the iron in our blood, the carbon in our apple pies were made in the interiors of collapsing stars. We are made of starstuff.

quotes.author: Carl Gustav Jung
quotes.quote: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.

quotes.author: Anne Frank
quotes.book: The Diary of a Young Girl
quotes.quote: I don't think of all the misery, but of the beauty that still remains.

quotes.author: Rainbow Rowell
quotes.quote: I don't trust anybody. Not anybody. And the more that I care about someone, the more sure I am they're going to get tired of me and take off.

quotes.author: David Henry Hwang
quotes.quote: I'm happy. Which often looks like crazy.

quotes.author: Jonathan Safran Foer
quotes.quote: I hope that one day you will have the experience of doing something you do not understand for someone you love.

quotes.author: Charlotte Bronte
