quotes.quote: I have for the first time found what I can truly love–I have found you. You are my sympathy–my better self–my good angel–I am bound to you with a strong attachment. I think you good, gifted, lovely: a fervent, a solemn passion is conceived in my heart; it leans to you, draws you to my centre and spring of life, wrap my existence about you–and, kindling in pure, powerful flame, fuses you and me in one.

quotes.author: Annie Proulx
quotes.quote: You should write because you love the shape of stories and sentences and the creation of different words on a page. Writing comes from reading, and reading is the finest teacher of how to write.

quotes.author: Melissa Marr
quotes.quote: Sometimes love means letting go when you want to hold on tighter.

quotes.author: George Carlin
quotes.quote: There are nights when the wolves are silent and only the moon howls.

quotes.author: Pablo Neruda
quotes.quote: But I love your feet only because they walked upon the earth and upon the wind and upon the waters, until they found me.

quotes.author: Pat Monahan
quotes.quote: You can only be young once. But you can always be immature.

quotes.author: Donald E. Westlake
quotes.quote: Nobody gets everything in this life. You decide your priorities and you make your choices. I'd decided long ago that any cake I had would be eaten.

quotes.author: Donna Tartt
quotes.quote: Beauty is terror. Whatever we call beautiful, we quiver before it.

quotes.author: Ayn Rand
quotes.quote: I could die for you. But I couldn't, and wouldn't, live for you.

quotes.author: Gary Paulsen
quotes.quote: If books could have more, give more, be more, show more, they would still need readers who bring to them sound and smell and light and all the rest that can't be in books. The book needs you.

quotes.author: Charles Dickens
quotes.quote: A wonderful fact to reflect upon, that every human creature is constituted to be that profound secret and mystery to every other.

quotes.author: Albert Einstein
quotes.quote: Everything must be made as simple as possible. But not simpler.

quotes.author: Alexander Pope
quotes.quote: To err is human, to forgive, divine.

quotes.author: John Green
quotes.quote: Talking to a drunk person was like talking to an extremely happy, severely brain-damaged three-year-old.

quotes.author: Moliere
quotes.quote: Trees that are slow to grow bear the best fruit.

quotes.author: Bill Watterson
quotes.quote: I'm killing time while I wait for life to shower me with meaning and happiness.

quotes.author: George Orwell
quotes.quote: The creatures outside looked from pig to man, and from man to pig, and from pig to man again; but already it was impossible to say which was which.

quotes.author: Stephen King
quotes.quote: If you liked being a teenager, there's something really wrong with you.

quotes.author: Steven Spielberg
quotes.quote: Only a generation of readers will spawn a generation of writers.

quotes.author: Ursula K. Le Guin
quotes.quote: It is good to have an end to journey toward; but it is the journey that matters, in the end.

quotes.author: virginia woolf
quotes.quote: As a woman I have no country. As a woman I want no country. As a woman, my country is the whole world.

quotes.author: Suzanne Collins
quotes.quote: Some walks you have to take alone.

quotes.author: Geraldine Brooks
quotes.quote: For to know a man's library is, in some measure, to know his mind.

quotes.author: James Burke
quotes.quote: When you read a book, you hold another's mind in your hands.

quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks
quotes.quote: Dreams are always crushing when they don't come true. But it's the simple dreams that are often the most painful because they seem so personal, so reasonable, so attainable. You're always close enough to touch, but never quite close enough to hold and it's enough to break your heart.

quotes.author: Colleen Hoover
quotes.quote: I got schooled this yearbyaboy.A boy that I'm seriously, deeply, madly, incredibly, and undeniably in love with.And he taught me the most important thing of all...To put the emphasisOn life.

quotes.author: Eleanor Hodgman Porter
quotes.quote: Be glad. Be good. Be brave.

quotes.author: Marilyn Monroe
quotes.quote: I don't mind making jokes, but I don't want to look like one.

quotes.author: Harlan Ellison
quotes.quote: You are not entitled to your opinion. You are entitled to your informed opinion. No one is entitled to be ignorant.

quotes.author: William Makepeace Thackeray
quotes.quote: Life is a mirror: if you frown at it, it frowns back; if you smile, it returns the greeting.

quotes.author: Charlotte Brontë
quotes.quote: I do not think, sir, you have any right to command me, merely because you are older than I, or because you have seen more of the world than I have; your claim to superiority depends on the use you have made of your time and experience.

quotes.author: Margaret Atwood
quotes.quote: Don't let the bastards grind you down.

quotes.author: J.M. Barrie
quotes.quote: Second star to the right and straight on 'til morning.

quotes.author: Oscar Wilde
quotes.quote: I have nothing to declare except my genius.

quotes.author: John Green
quotes.quote: I'm on a roller coaster that only goes up, my friend.

quotes.author: J.D. Salinger
quotes.quote: I like it when somebody gets excited about something. It's nice.

quotes.author: Mark Twain
quotes.quote: Education: the path from cocky ignorance to miserable uncertainty.

quotes.author: Edith Wharton
quotes.quote: There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that receives it.

quotes.author: Mitch Albom
quotes.quote: When someone is in your heart, they're never truly gone. They can come back to you, even at unlikely times.

quotes.author: Jane Yolen
quotes.book: Touch Magic: Fantasy, Faerie & Folklore in the Literature of Childhood
quotes.quote: Literature is a textually transmitted disease, normally contracted in childhood.

quotes.author: Albert Einstein
quotes.quote: The best way to cheer yourself is to cheer somebody else up.

quotes.author: Jean de La Fontaine
quotes.quote: A person often meets his destiny on the road he took to avoid it.

quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quotes.quote: In individuals, insanity is rare; but in groups, parties, nations and epochs, it is the rule.

quotes.author: Paula Poundstone
quotes.quote: Adults are always asking little kids what they want to be when they grow up 'cause they're looking for ideas.

quotes.author: Michel de Montaigne
quotes.quote: The most certain sign of wisdom is cheerfulness.

quotes.author: Tahereh Mafi
quotes.quote: The moon is a loyal companion.It never leaves. It's always there, watching, steadfast, knowing us in our light and dark moments, changing forever just as we do. Every day it's a different version of itself. Sometimes weak and wan, sometimes strong and full of light. The moon understands what it means to be human.Uncertain. Alone. Cratered by imperfections.

quotes.author: Bei Dao
quotes.quote: In the world I amAlways a strangerI do not understand its languageIt does not understand my silence

quotes.author: Caroline Gordon
quotes.quote: A well-composed book is a magic carpet on which we are wafted to a world that we cannot enter in any other way.

quotes.author: Mitch Albom
quotes.book: The Five People You Meet in Heaven
quotes.quote: Holding anger is a poison...It eats you from inside...We think that by hating someone we hurt them...But hatred is a curved blade...and the harm we do to others...we also do to ourselves.

quotes.author: Ray Bradbury
quotes.quote: There is more than one way to burn a book. And the world is full of people running about with lit matches.

quotes.author: Louis L'Amour
quotes.quote: Once you have read a book you care about, some part of it is always with you.

quotes.author: George Orwell
quotes.quote: If you want to keep a secret, you must also hide it from yourself.

quotes.author: Neil Gaiman
quotes.quote: This is how you do it: you sit down at the keyboard and you put one word after another until its done. It's that easy, and that hard.

quotes.author: Rumi Jalalud-Din
quotes.quote: Ignore those that make you fearful and sad, that degrade you back towards disease and death.

quotes.author: Zadie Smith
quotes.quote: The past is always tense, the future perfect.

quotes.author: Sylvia Plath
quotes.book: The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath
quotes.quote: I desire the things that will destroy me in the end.

quotes.author: Laura Ingalls Wilder
quotes.quote: I am beginning to learn that it is the sweet, simple things of life which are the real ones after all.

quotes.author: Frida Kahlo
quotes.quote: At the end of the day, we can endure much more than we think we can.

quotes.author: Richard Matheson
quotes.quote: That which you believe becomes your world.

quotes.author: Veronica Roth
quotes.quote: I feel like someone breathed new air into my lungs. I am not Abnegation. I am not Dauntless. I am Divergent.

quotes.author: Charles M. Schulz
quotes.quote: Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love.

quotes.author: Honoré de Balzac
quotes.quote: All happiness depends on courage and work.

quotes.author: Mitch Albom
quotes.quote: So many people walk around with a meaningless life. They seem half-asleep, even when they're busy doing things they think are important. This is because they're chasing the wrong things. The way you get meaning into your life is to devote yourself to loving others, devote yourself to your community around you, and devote yourself to creating something that gives you purpose and meaning.

quotes.author: Gayle Forman
quotes.quote: If you stay, I'll do whatever you want. I'll quit the band, go with you to New York. But if you need me to go away, I'll do that, too. I was talking to Liz and she said maybe coming back to your old life would be too painful, that maybe it'd be easier for you to erase us. And that would suck, but I'd do it. I can lose you like that if I don't lose you today. I'll let you go. If you stay.

quotes.author: Fannie Flagg
quotes.book: Fried Green Tomatoes at the Whistle Stop Cafe
quotes.quote: I wonder how many people don't get the one they want, but end up with the one they're supposed to be with.

quotes.author: Lauren Conrad
quotes.quote: Don't cry over someone who wouldn't cry over you.

quotes.author: Laurie Halse Anderson
quotes.quote: In one aspect, yes, I believe in ghosts, but we create them. We haunt ourselves.

quotes.author: Marilyn Monroe
quotes.quote: Wanting to be someone else is a waste of the person you are.

quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway
quotes.quote: All good books are alike in that they are truer than if they had really happened and after you are finished reading one you will feel that all that happened to you and afterwards it all belongs to you: the good and the bad, the ecstasy, the remorse and sorrow, the people and the places and how the weather was. If you can get so that you can give that to people, then you are a writer.

quotes.author: Lauren Oliver
quotes.quote: I guess that's what saying good-bye is always like--like jumping off an edge. The worst part is making the choice to do it. Once you're in the air, there's nothing you can do but let go.

quotes.author: Nora Roberts
quotes.quote: Some things in life are out of your control. You can make it a party or a tragedy.

quotes.author: Katherine Anne Porter
quotes.quote: The past is never where you think you left it.

quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett
quotes.quote: If you want to be happy, do not dwell in the past, do not worry about the future, focus on living fully in the present.

quotes.author: Viktor E. Frankl
quotes.quote: Everything can be taken from a man but one thing: the last of the human freedoms-to choose one's attitude in any given set of circumstances, to choose one's own way.

quotes.author: Oscar Wilde
quotes.quote: Behind every exquisite thing that existed, there was something tragic.

quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk
quotes.quote: If death meant just leaving the stage long enough to change costume and come back as a new character...Would you slow down? Or speed up?

quotes.author: Mark Twain
quotes.quote: The best way to cheer yourself is to try to cheer someone else up.

quotes.author: Francois Duc de la Rochefoucauld
quotes.quote: Absence diminishes small loves and increases great ones, as the wind blows out the candle and fans the bonfire.

quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi
quotes.quote: The future depends on what you do today.

quotes.author: Amy Tan
quotes.quote: We dream to give ourselves hope. To stop dreaming - well, that's like saying you can never change your fate.

quotes.author: Jack Kerouac
quotes.quote: The only truth is music.

quotes.author: Washington Irving
quotes.quote: A mother is the truest friend we have, when trials heavy and sudden fall upon us; when adversity takes the place of prosperity; when friends desert us; when trouble thickens around us, still will she cling to us, and endeavor by her kind precepts and counsels to dissipate the clouds of darkness, and cause peace to return to our hearts.

quotes.author: Paulo Coelho
quotes.quote: The two hardest tests on the spiritual road are the patience to wait for the right moment and the courage not to be disappointed with what we encounter.

quotes.author: Nelson Mandela
quotes.quote: I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.

quotes.author: Anais Nin
quotes.quote: I must be a mermaid, Rango. I have no fear of depths and a great fear of shallow living.

quotes.author: Jack Kerouac
quotes.quote: Nothing behind me, everything ahead of me, as is ever so on the road.

quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
quotes.quote: Whenever you feel like criticizing any one...just remember that all the people in this world haven't had the advantages that you've had.

quotes.author: Rick Riordan
quotes.quote: You deal with mythological stuff for a few years, you learn that paradises are usually places where you get killed.

quotes.author: Jennifer Egan
quotes.book: A Visit from the Goon Squad
quotes.quote: I'm always happy, sometimes I just forget.

quotes.author: Art Spiegelman
quotes.book: Maus I: A Survivor's Tale: My Father Bleeds History
quotes.quote: To die, it's easy. But you have to struggle for life.

quotes.author: Margaret Mitchell
quotes.quote: With enough courage, you can do without a reputation.

quotes.author: E. E. Cummings
quotes.quote: We do not believe in ourselves until someone reveals that deep inside us something is valuable, worth listening to, worthy of our trust, sacred to our touch. Once we believe in ourselves we can risk curiosity, wonder, spontaneous delight or any experience that reveals the human spirit.

quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey
quotes.quote: Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough

quotes.author: Harper Lee
quotes.quote: They're certainly entitled to think that, and they're entitled to full respect for their opinions... but before I can live with other folks I've got to live with myself. The one thing that doesn't abide by majority rule is a person's conscience.

quotes.author: Leigh Bardugo
quotes.quote: Many boys will bring you flowers. But someday you'll meet a boy who will learn your favorite flower, your favorite song, your favorite sweet. And even if he is too poor to give you any of them, it won't matter because he will have taken the time to know you as no one else does. Only that boy earns your heart.

quotes.author: Anaïs Nin
quotes.book: Incest: From a Journal of Love
quotes.quote: Reality doesn't impress me. I only believe in intoxication, in ecstasy, and when ordinary life shackles me, I escape, one way or another. No more walls.

quotes.author: Gore Vidal
quotes.quote: The unfed mind devours itself.

quotes.author: Anne Frank
quotes.quote: Parents can only give good advice or put them on the right paths, but the final forming of a person's character lies in their own hands.

quotes.author: Lao Tzu
quotes.quote: When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everyone will respect you.

quotes.author: Lemony Snicket
quotes.quote: ...you know that a good, long session of weeping can often make you feel better, even if your circumstances have not changed one bit.

quotes.author: Rick Riordan
quotes.quote: It's hard to enjoy practical jokes when your whole life feels like one.

quotes.author: Philip José Farmer
quotes.quote: Imagination is like a muscle. I found out that the more I wrote, the bigger it got.

quotes.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
quotes.quote: It's the job that's never started as takes longest to finish.

quotes.author: Laini Taylor
quotes.quote: Have you ever asked yourself, do monsters make war, or does war make monsters?

quotes.author: John W. Campbell Jr.
quotes.quote: History does not always repeat itself. Sometimes it just yells, 'Can't you remember anything I told you?' and lets fly with a club.

quotes.author: W.E.B. DuBois
quotes.quote: Children learn more from what you are than what you teach.

quotes.author: Mitch Albom
quotes.quote: Have you ever lost someone you love and wanted one more conversation, one more chance to make up for the time when you thought they would be here forever? If so, then you know you can go your whole life collecting days, and none will outweigh the one you wish you had back.

quotes.author: Rainbow Rowell
quotes.quote: I want everyone to meet you. You're my favorite person of all time.

quotes.author: Elizabeth Gilbert
quotes.book: Committed: A Skeptic Makes Peace with Marriage
quotes.quote: To be fully seen by somebody, then, and be loved anyhow - this is a human offering that can border on miraculous.

quotes.author: David Levithan
quotes.quote: If there's one thing I've learned, it's this: We all want everything to be okay. We don't even wish so much for fantastic or marvelous or outstanding. We will happily settle for okay, because most of the time, okay is enough.

quotes.author: Mark Twain
quotes.quote: Name the greatest of all inventors. Accident.

quotes.author: Terry Pratchett
quotes.quote: If you have enough book space, I don't want to talk to you.

quotes.author: David Foster Wallace
quotes.quote: The truth will set you free. But not until it is finished with you.

quotes.author: Noam Chomsky
quotes.quote: We shouldn't be looking for heroes, we should be looking for good ideas.

quotes.author: Becca Fitzpatrick
quotes.quote: Being with you never felt wrong. It's the one thing I did right. You're the one thing I did right.

quotes.author: Taylor Swift
quotes.quote: I suffer from girlnextdooritis where the guy is friends with you and that's it.

quotes.author: Seamus Heaney
quotes.book: Stepping Stones: Interviews with Seamus Heaney
quotes.quote: If you have the words, there's always a chance that you'll find the way.

quotes.author: Jonathan Kellerman
quotes.quote: Life is like a prism. What you see depends on how you turn the glass.

quotes.author: Charles Bukowski
quotes.book: The People Look Like Flowers at Last
quotes.quote: A love like that was a serious illness, an illness from which you never entirely recover.

quotes.author: Jon Krakauer
quotes.quote: make a radical change in your lifestyle and begin to boldly do things which you may previously never have thought of doing, or been too hesitant to attempt. So many people live within unhappy circumstances and yet will not take the initiative to change their situation because they are conditioned to a life of security, conformity, and conservation, all of which may appear to give one peace of mind, but in reality nothing is more damaging to the adventurous spirit within a man than a secure future. The very basic core of a man's living spirit is his passion for adventure. The joy of life comes from our encounters with new experiences, and hence there is no greater joy than to have an endlessly changing horizon, for each day to have a new and different sun. If you want to get more out of life, you must lose your inclination for monotonous security and adopt a helter-skelter style of life that will at first appear to you to be crazy. But once you become accustomed to such a life you will see its full meaning and its incredible beauty.

quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi
quotes.quote: A man is but the product of his thoughts. What he thinks, he becomes.

quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk
quotes.quote: The things you used to own, now they own you.

quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln
quotes.quote: Books serve to show a man that those original thoughts of his aren't very new after all.

quotes.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning
quotes.quote: How do I love thee? Let me count the ways.I love thee to the depth and breadth and heightMy soul can reach

quotes.author: John Green
quotes.quote: But I believe in true love, you know? I don't believe that everybody gets to keep their eyes or not get sick or whatever, but everybody should have true love, and it should last at least as long as your life does.

quotes.author: Oscar Wilde
quotes.quote: Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months.

quotes.author: Sylvia Plath
quotes.quote: Can you understand? Someone, somewhere, can you understand me a little, love me a little? For all my despair, for all my ideals, for all that - I love life. But it is hard, and I have so much - so very much to learn.

quotes.author: Walt Disney
quotes.quote: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.

quotes.author: Cassandra Clare
quotes.quote: They say time heals all wounds, but that presumes the source of the grief is finite

quotes.author: Julie Kagawa
quotes.quote: Oh, we're playing nice now? Shall we have tea first? Brew up a nice pot of kiss-my-ass?

quotes.author: Nicole Krauss
quotes.quote: there are two types of people in the world: those who prefer to be sad among others, and those who prefer to be sad alone.

quotes.author: Oscar Wilde
quotes.quote: A man's face is his autobiography. A woman's face is her work of fiction.

quotes.author: Nadezhda Mandelstam
quotes.quote: I decided it is better to scream. Silence is the real crime against humanity.

quotes.author: Marilyn Monroe
quotes.quote: You never know what life is like, until you have lived it.

quotes.author: Tennessee Williams
quotes.quote: What is straight? A line can be straight, or a street, but the human heart, oh, no, it's curved like a road through mountains.

quotes.author: Doris Lessing
quotes.quote: What's terrible is to pretend that second-rate is first-rate. To pretend that you don't need love when you do; or you like your work when you know quite well you're capable of better.

quotes.author: Rumi
quotes.quote: In your light I learn how to love. In your beauty, how to make poems. You dance inside my chest where no-one sees you, but sometimes I do, and that sight becomes this art.

quotes.author: George R.R. Martin
quotes.quote: The man who passes the sentence should swing the sword. If you would take a man's life, you owe it to him to look into his eyes and hear his final words. And if you cannot bear to do that, then perhaps the man does not deserve to die.

quotes.author: Jane Austen
quotes.quote: I must learn to be content with being happier than I deserve.

quotes.author: Ellen Bass
quotes.quote: to love life, to love it evenwhen you have no stomach for itand everything you've held dearcrumbles like burnt paper in your hands,your throat filled with the silt of it.When grief sits with you, its tropical heatthickening the air, heavy as watermore fit for gills than lungs;when grief weights you like your own fleshonly more of it, an obesity of grief,you think, How can a body withstand this?Then you hold life like a facebetween your palms, a plain face,no charming smile, no violet eyes,and you say, yes, I will take youI will love you, again.

quotes.author: Albert Einstein
quotes.quote: When you trip over love, it is easy to get up. But when you fall in love, it is impossible to stand again.

quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
quotes.quote: Many people will walk in and out of your life, but only true friends will leave footprints in your heart

quotes.author: Zig Ziglar
quotes.book: Raising Positive Kids in a Negative World
quotes.quote: Of course motivation is not permanent. But then, neither is bathing; but it is something you should do on a regular basis.

quotes.author: Rachel Caine
quotes.quote: Damn, Claire. Warn a guy before you do a face-plant on the floor next time. I could have looked all heroic and caught you or something -Shane

quotes.author: Audre Lorde
quotes.quote: Your silence will not protect you.

quotes.author: Aristotle
quotes.quote: Hope is a waking dream.

quotes.author: Stephen Fry
quotes.quote: Books are no more threatened by Kindle than stairs by elevators.

quotes.author: Rose Wilder Lane
quotes.quote: Happiness is something that comes into our lives through doors we don't even remember leaving open.

quotes.author: Kiera Cass
quotes.quote: True love is usually the most inconvenient kind.

quotes.author: Douglas Adams
quotes.book: The Restaurant at the End of the Universe
quotes.quote: The major problem-one of the major problems, for there are several-one of the many major problems with governing people is that of whom you get to do it; or rather of who manages to get people to let them do it to them. To summarize: it is a well-known fact that those people who must want to rule people are, ipso facto, those least suited to do it. To summarize the summary: anyone who is capable of getting themselves made President should on no account be allowed to do the job.

quotes.author: Flannery O'Connor
quotes.quote: She looked at nice young men as if she could smell their stupidity.

quotes.author: Erin Morgenstern
quotes.quote: The finest of pleasures are always the unexpected ones.

quotes.author: Søren Kierkegaard
quotes.book: The Concept of Anxiety: A Simple Psychologically Orienting Deliberation on the Dogmatic Issue of Hereditary Sin
quotes.quote: Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom.

quotes.author: Sherman Alexie
quotes.book: The Absolutely True Diary of a Part-Time Indian
quotes.quote: If you let people into your life a little bit, they can be pretty damn amazing.

quotes.author: Charles Dickens
quotes.quote: Heaven knows we need never be ashamed of our tears, for they are rain upon the blinding dust of earth, overlying our hard hearts. I was better after I had cried, than before--more sorry, more aware of my own ingratitude, more gentle.

quotes.author: Selma Lagerlöf
quotes.quote: Nothing on earth can make up for the loss of one who has loved you.

quotes.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
quotes.quote: We dream in our waking moments, and walk in our sleep.

quotes.author: Joseph Conrad
quotes.quote: It's only those who do nothing that make no mistakes, I suppose.

quotes.author: Leonard Cohen
quotes.quote: There is a crack in everything.That's how the light gets in.

quotes.author: Steve Maraboli
quotes.book: Life, the Truth, and Being Free
quotes.quote: I want to be in a relationship where you telling me you love me is just a ceremonious validation of what you already show me.

quotes.author: Maya Angelou
quotes.quote: You alone are enough. You have nothing to prove to anybody.

quotes.author: Daphne du Maurier
quotes.quote: Women want love to be a novel. Men, a short story.

quotes.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning
quotes.quote: You're something between a dream and a miracle.

quotes.author: Haruki Murakami
quotes.quote: But I didn't understand then. That I could hurt somebody so badly she would never recover. That a person can, just by living, damage another human being beyond repair.

quotes.author: Jonathan Safran Foer
quotes.quote: Why do beautiful songs make you sad?' 'Because they aren't true.' 'Never?' 'Nothing is beautiful and true.

quotes.author: Paulo Coelho
quotes.quote: There are moments when troubles enter our lives and we can do nothing to avoid them.But they are there for a reason. Only when we have overcome them will we understand why they were there.

quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.
quotes.quote: Intelligence plus character-that is the goal of true education.

quotes.author: Albert Dietrich
quotes.book: Army Gi, Pacifist Co: The World War II Letters of Frank Dietrich and Albert Dietrich
quotes.quote: There are perhaps many causes worth dying for, but to me, certainly, there are none worth killing for.

quotes.author: Harper Lee
quotes.quote: There are just some kind of men who - who're so busy worrying about the next world they've never learned to live in this one, and you can look down the street and see the results.

quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy
quotes.quote: If, then, I were asked for the most important advice I could give, that which I considered to be the most useful to the men of our century, I should simply say: in the name of God, stop a moment, cease your work, look around you.

quotes.author: Marcel Proust
quotes.quote: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.

quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway
quotes.book: The Old Man and the Sea
quotes.quote: Every day is a new day. It is better to be lucky. But I would rather be exact. Then when luck comes you are ready.

quotes.author: Taylor Swift
quotes.quote: This is a new year. A new beginning. And things will change.

quotes.author: Carlos Castaneda
quotes.quote: You have everything needed for the extravagant journey that is your life.

quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks
quotes.quote: Without you in my arms, I feel an emptiness in my soul. I find myself searching the crowds for your face - I know it's an impossibility, but I cannot help myself.

quotes.author: Robert Frost
quotes.quote: Freedom lies in being bold.

quotes.author: Veronica Roth
quotes.quote: Sometimes, the best way to help someone is just to be near them.

quotes.author: Agatha Christie
quotes.quote: The impossible could not have happened, therefore the impossible must be possible in spite of appearances.

quotes.author: Kurt Vonnegut Jr.
quotes.quote: And I urge you to please notice when you are happy, and exclaim or murmur or think at some point, 'If this isn't nice, I don't know what is.

quotes.author: Cassandra Clare
quotes.quote: Whatever you are physically matter less than what your heart contains. If you have the soul of a warrior, you are a warrior. All those other things, they are the glass that contains the lamp, but you are the light inside.

quotes.author: Fred Rogers
quotes.quote: When I say it's you I like, I'm talking about that part of you that knows that life is far more than anything you can ever see or hear or touch. That deep part of you that allows you to stand for those things without which humankind cannot survive. Love that conquers hate, peace that rises triumphant over war, and justice that proves more powerful than greed.

quotes.author: Neil Gaiman
quotes.book: The Ocean at the End of the Lane
quotes.quote: Grown-ups don't look like grown-ups on the inside either. Outside, they're big and thoughtless and they always know what they're doing. Inside, they look just like they always have. Like they did when they were your age. Truth is, there aren't any grown-ups. Not one, in the whole wide world.

quotes.author: Jandy Nelson
quotes.quote: Maybe some people are just meant to be in the same story.

quotes.author: Sarah Dessen
quotes.quote: Holding people away from you, and denying yourself love, that doesn't make you strong. if anything, it makes you weaker. Because you're doing it out of fear.

quotes.author: Gertrude Stein
quotes.quote: One must dare to be happy.

quotes.author: Henry Thomas Buckle
quotes.quote: Great minds discuss ideas. Average minds discuss events. Small minds discuss people.

quotes.author: David Nicholls
quotes.quote: This is where it all begins. Everything starts here, today.

quotes.author: C.S. Lewis
quotes.quote: The homemaker has the ultimate career. All other careers exist for one purpose only - and that is to support the ultimate career.

quotes.author: Roald Dahl
quotes.quote: A person who has good thoughts cannot ever be ugly. You can have a wonky nose and a crooked mouth and a double chin and stick-out teeth, but if you have good thoughts they will shine out of your face like sunbeams and you will always look lovely.

quotes.author: Walter Tevis
quotes.quote: I feel free and strong. If I were not a reader of books I could not feel this way.

quotes.author: Suzanne Collins
quotes.quote: District 12: Where you can starve to death in safety.

quotes.author: Alyson Noel
quotes.quote: I guess by now I should know enough about loss to realize that you never really stop missing someone-you just learn to live around the huge gaping hole of their absence.

quotes.author: Ian Fleming
quotes.quote: You only live twice:Once when you are bornAnd once when you look death in the face

quotes.author: Rachel Carson
quotes.quote: The more clearly we can focus our attention on the wonders and realities of the universe about us, the less taste we shall have for destruction.

quotes.author: John Green
quotes.quote: Sometimes you lose a battle. But mischief always wins the war

quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett
quotes.quote: We are all different. Don't judge, understand instead.

quotes.author: Victor Hugo
quotes.quote: Love is like a tree: it grows by itself, roots itself deeply in our being and continues to flourish over a heart in ruin. The inexplicable fact is that the blinder it is, the more tenacious it is. It is never stronger than when it is completely unreasonable.

quotes.author: Umberto Eco
quotes.book: The Island of the Day Before
quotes.quote: To survive, you must tell stories.

quotes.author: Hafiz
quotes.quote: Even After All this time The Sun never says to the Earth,"You owe me."Look What happens With a love like that, It lights the whole sky.

quotes.author: Dr. Seuss
quotes.quote: I'm afraid that sometimes you'll play lonely games too. Games you can't win 'cause you'll play against you.

quotes.author: Edward Abbey
quotes.quote: May your trails be crooked, winding, lonesome, dangerous, leading to the most amazing view.

quotes.author: C. JoyBell C.
quotes.quote: We can't be afraid of change. You may feel very secure in the pond that you are in, but if you never venture out of it, you will never know that there is such a thing as an ocean, a sea. Holding onto something that is good for you now, may be the very reason why you don't have something better.

quotes.author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón
quotes.quote: People tend to complicate their own lives, as if living weren't already complicated enough.

quotes.author: Albert Einstein
quotes.quote: What is right is not always popular and what is popular is not always right.

quotes.author: Margaret Atwood
quotes.quote: Men are afraid that women will laugh at them. Women are afraid that men will kill them.

quotes.author: Groucho Marx
quotes.quote: I never forget a face, but in your case I'll be glad to make an exception.

quotes.author: H.L. Mencken
quotes.quote: I know some who are constantly drunk on books as other men are drunk on whiskey.

quotes.author: T.S. Eliot
quotes.book: The Use of Poetry and the Use of Criticism
quotes.quote: To do the useful thing, to say the courageous thing, to contemplate the beautiful thing: that is enough for one man's life.

quotes.author: Dan Brown
quotes.quote: Men go to far greater lengths to avoid what they fear than to obtain what they desire.

quotes.author: Oscar Wilde
quotes.quote: Anybody can sympathise with the sufferings of a friend, but it requires a very fine nature to sympathise with a friend's success.

quotes.author: Ellen DeGeneres
quotes.quote: My grandmother started walking five miles a day when she was sixty. She's ninety-seven now, and we don't know where the heck she is.

quotes.author: John Green
quotes.quote: It is easy to forget how full the world is of people, full to bursting, and each of them imaginable and consistently misimagined.

quotes.author: Thomas Pynchon
quotes.quote: Every weirdo in the world is on my wavelength.

quotes.author: Victor Hugo
quotes.quote: The power of a glance has been so much abused in love stories, that it has come to be disbelieved in. Few people dare now to say that two beings have fallen in love because they have looked at each other. Yet it is in this way that love begins, and in this way only.

quotes.author: Philip Pullman
quotes.quote: We don't need a list of rights and wrongs, tables of dos and don'ts: we need books, time, and silence. Thou shalt not is soon forgotten, but Once upon a time lasts forever.

quotes.author: David Mitchell
quotes.quote: Our lives are not our own. We are bound to others, past and present, and by each crime and every kindness, we birth our future.

quotes.author: Jonathan Ames
quotes.book: My Less Than Secret Life: A Diary, Fiction, Essays
quotes.quote: I live for coincidences. They briefly give to me the illusion or the hope that there's a pattern to my life, and if there's a pattern, then maybe I'm moving toward some kind of destiny where it's all explained.

quotes.author: Marilyn Monroe
quotes.quote: I restore myself when I'm alone.

quotes.author: Zora Neale Hurston
quotes.quote: Love makes your soul crawl out from its hiding place.

quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi
quotes.quote: To give pleasure to a single heart by a single act is better than a thousand heads bowing in prayer.

quotes.author: Albert Camus
quotes.quote: In the midst of winter, I found there was, within me, an invincible summer.And that makes me happy. For it says that no matter how hard the world pushes against me, within me, there's something stronger – something better, pushing right back.

quotes.author: Gertrude Stein
quotes.quote: We are always the same age inside.

quotes.author: Steve Jobs
quotes.quote: Being the richest man in the cemetery doesn't matter to me. Going to bed at night saying we've done something wonderful... that's what matters to me.

quotes.author: J.K. Rowling
quotes.book: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
quotes.quote: I'm going to keep going until I succeed - or die. Don't think I don't know how this might end. I've known it for years.

quotes.author: Katherine Mansfield
quotes.quote: The mind I love must have wild places.

quotes.author: John Green
quotes.quote: When things break, it's not the actual breaking that prevents them from getting back together again. It's because a little piece gets lost - the two remaining ends couldn't fit together even if they wanted to. The whole shape has changed.

quotes.author: John Green
quotes.quote: I am going to take this bucket of water and pour it on the flames of hell, and then I am going to use this torch to burn down the gates of paradise so that people will not love God for want of heaven or fear of hell, but because He is God.

quotes.author: Markus Zusak
quotes.quote: He was the crazy one who had painted himself black and defeated the world.She was the book thief without the words.Trust me, though, the words were on their way, and when they arrived, Liesel would hold them in her hands like the clouds, and she would wring them out like rain.

quotes.author: Judy Garland
quotes.quote: Always be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else.

quotes.author: Ira Glass
quotes.quote: Nobody tells this to people who are beginners, I wish someone told me. All of us who do creative work, we get into it because we have good taste. But there is this gap. For the first couple years you make stuff, it's just not that good. It's trying to be good, it has potential, but it's not. But your taste, the thing that got you into the game, is still killer. And your taste is why your work disappoints you. A lot of people never get past this phase, they quit. Most people I know who do interesting, creative work went through years of this. We know our work doesn't have this special thing that we want it to have. We all go through this. And if you are just starting out or you are still in this phase, you gotta know its normal and the most important thing you can do is do a lot of work. Put yourself on a deadline so that every week you will finish one story. It is only by going through a volume of work that you will close that gap, and your work will be as good as your ambitions. And I took longer to figure out how to do this than anyone I've ever met. It's gonna take awhile. It's normal to take awhile. You've just gotta fight your way through.

quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quotes.author: C. J. Cherryh

quotes.author: Anais Nin

quotes.author: Jeanette Winterson

quotes.author: Tahereh Mafi

quotes.author: Suzanne Collins

quotes.author: Jarod Kintz

quotes.author: C. S. Lewis

quotes.author: Victor Hugo

quotes.author: Sarah J. Maas

quotes.author: Alice McDermott

quotes.author: Sarah Vowell

quotes.author: Jack London

quotes.author: Marvin Bell

quotes.author: Paulo Coelho

quotes.author: Neil Jordan
quotes.quote: Is it fair to have given us the memory of what was and the desire of what could be when we must suffer what is?

quotes.author: R.J. Palacio
quotes.quote: I think there should be a rule that everyone in the world should get a standing ovation at least once in their lives.

quotes.author: Stephen Chbosky
quotes.book: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
quotes.quote: I am both happy and sad at the same time, and I'm still trying to figure out how that could be.

quotes.author: Mother Teresa
quotes.quote: Let no one ever come to you without leaving better and happier. Be the living expression of God's kindness: kindness in your face, kindness in your eyes, kindness in your smile.

quotes.author: Louisa May Alcott
quotes.quote: I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship.

quotes.author: Toni Morrison
quotes.quote: Freeing yourself was one thing, claiming ownership of that freed self was another.

quotes.author: Roberto Bolaño
quotes.quote: Reading is like thinking, like praying, like talking to a friend, like expressing your ideas, like listening to other people's ideas, like listening to music, like looking at the view, like taking a walk on the beach.

quotes.author: Oscar Wilde
quotes.quote: We are each our own devil, and we make this world our hell.

quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quotes.quote: The earth laughs in flowers.

quotes.author: Mae West
quotes.quote: When I'm good, I'm very good, but when I'm bad, I'm better.

quotes.author: William Shakespeare

Out, out, brief candle!Life's but a walking shadow, a poor player,That struts and frets his hour upon the stage,And then is heard no more. It is a taleTold by an idiot, full of sound and fury,Signifying nothing.

quotes.author: Steve Maraboli

quotes.quote: Incredible change happens in your life when you decide to take control of what you do have power over instead of craving control over what you don't.

quotes.author: Margaret Atwood

quotes.author: Sinclair Lewis
quotes.quote: We'd get sick on too many cookies, but ever so much sicker on no cookies at all.

quotes.author: Khalil Gibran
quotes.quote: One day you will ask me which is more important? My life or yours? I will say mine and you will walk away not knowing that you are my life.

quotes.author: Groucho Marx
quotes.quote: Humor is reason gone mad.

quotes.author: Suzanne Collins
quotes.quote: It crosses my mind that Cinna's calm and normal demeanor masks a complete madman.

quotes.author: Douglas Adams

quotes.author: Haruki Murakami

quotes.author: Sherrilyn Kenyon

quotes.author: John Keats

quotes.quote: The question is not what you look at, but what you see.

quotes.author: Will Rogers
quotes.quote: Never miss a good chance to shut up.

quotes.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
quotes.quote: Therefore, dear Sir, love your solitude and try to sing out with the pain it causes you. For those who are near you are far away... and this shows that the space around you is beginning to grow vast.... be happy about your growth, in which of course you can't take anyone with you, and be gentle with those who stay behind; be confident and calm in front of them and don't torment them with your doubts and don't frighten them with your faith or joy, which they wouldn't be able to comprehend. Seek out some simple and true feeling of what you have in common with them, which doesn't necessarily have to alter when you yourself change again and again; when you see them, love life in a form that is not your own and be indulgent toward those who are growing old, who are afraid of the aloneness that you trust.... and don't expect any understanding; but believe in a love that is being stored up for you like an inheritance, and have faith that in this love there is a strength and a blessing so large that you can travel as far as you wish without having to step outside it.

quotes.author: Norman Vincent Peale

quotes.author: Oscar Wilde
quotes.quote: No good deed goes unpunished.

quotes.author: Dean Koontz

quotes.author: Simone de Beauvoir

quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.author: Paulo Coelho

No one wants their life thrown into chaos. That is why a lot of people keep that threat under control, and are somehow capable of sustaining a house or a structure that is already rotten. They are the engineers of the superseded. Other people think exactly the opposite: they surrender themselves without a second thought, hoping to find in passion the solutions to all their problems. They make the other person responsible for their happiness and blame them for their possible unhappiness. They are either euphoric because something marvelous has happened or depressed because something unexpected has just ruined everything. Keeping passion at bay or surrendering blindly to it - which of these two attitudes is the least destructive? I don't know.

quotes.author: Judith McNaught

When that happens, you do it. Listen to your instincts and ignore everything else. Ignore logic, ignore the odds, ignore the complications, and just go for it.

quotes.author: Elizabeth Gilbert
quotes.book: Eat, Pray, Love: One Woman's Search for Everything

quotes.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quotes.author: George R.R. Martin

quotes.author: Charles Darwin

quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.author: China Miéville

quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.author: Joseph Mitchell
quotes.quote: ...you can hate a place with all your heart and soul and still be homesick for it.

quotes.author: Ben Okri

quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.author: Stephen King

quotes.author: Anne Enright

quotes.author: judy blume

quotes.author: Stephen R. Covey

For example, in your case you always forgot who you are and how much you're loved. So what I do for you as your friend is remind you who you are and tell you how much I love you. And this isn't any kind of burden for me, because I love who you are very much. Every time I remind you, I get to remember with you, which is my pleasure.

quotes.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quotes.author: George Washington Burnap

quotes.author: Walt Whitman
quotes.quote: Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you.

quotes.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway
quotes.quote: All thinking men are atheists.

quotes.author: E. E. Cummings
quotes.quote: I will take the sun in my mouthand leap into the ripe air Alive with closed eyesto dash against darkness

quotes.author: Bob Newhart
quotes.quote: I think you should be a child for as long as you can. I have been successful for 74 years being able to do that.

quotes.author: Brian Selznick

quotes.author: J.K. Rowling

quotes.author: Neil Gaiman
quotes.quote: You get what anybody gets - you get a lifetime.

quotes.author: Bill Watterson

quotes.author: Sarah Kay
quotes.quote: If I should have a daughter...'Instead of 'Mom

quotes.author: Cheris Kramarae
quotes.quote: Feminism is the radical notion that women are human beings.

quotes.author: William Nicholson

quotes.author: Cormac McCarthy

quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
quotes.quote: I say let the world go to hell, but I should always have my tea.

quotes.author: Dalai Lama XIV

quotes.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quotes.author: Sarah Dessen
quotes.quote: Silence is so freaking loud

quotes.author: Maxim Gorky

quotes.quote: Happiness always looks small while you hold it in your hands, but let it go, and you learn at once how big and precious it is.

quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks

quotes.author: Patricia Cornwell

quotes.author: LeVar Burton

quotes.author: Bruce Lee

quotes.author: Anna Akhmatova

quotes.author: Ken Kesey

quotes.quote: Man, when you lose your laugh you lose your footing.

quotes.author: Sigrid Undset

quotes.author: John Green

quotes.author: Nizar Qabbani
quotes.quote: In the summerI stretch out on the shoreAnd think of you. Had I told the seaWhat I felt for you,It would have left its shores,Its shells,Its fish,And followed me.

quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.author: John Muir
quotes.quote: The mountains are calling and I must go.

quotes.author: George R.R. Martin
quotes.quote: The things we love destroy us every time, lad. Remember that.

quotes.author: Ludwig van Beethoven
quotes.quote: Music is ... A higher revelation than all Wisdom & Philosophy

quotes.author: Richelle Mead

quotes.author: Hayley Williams
quotes.quote: Sometimes it takes a good fall to really know where you stand

quotes.author: Jojo Moyes

quotes.author: Robert J. Sawyer

quotes.author: Anais Nin

quotes.author: C. JoyBell C.

quotes.author: Walt Disney

quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.author: Ayn Rand

quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.author: Ray Bradbury

quotes.author: Jane Austen
quotes.quote: It isn't what we say or think that defines us, but what we do.

quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett
